Bridget is a resident of the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. Bridget owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for one year. She began this business from a loan that she obtained from a friend. She also sells charcoal.

She learned about Milango Financial Services from other clients, and joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is the scarcity of charcoal as well as price fluctuations.

Bridget is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan Shillings to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar and charcoal. The extra income from this loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living conditions. She aspires to own other centers and plan for her child’s education with much security.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar and charcoal

loans.name: Consistence's' Group

texts.en:
Consistence's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Consistence is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past two years, Consistence has been working hard to manage her small business selling fashionable clothes.

To help expand her business, Consistence has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more new clothes to be sold, which will help Consistence generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Consistence hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a bigger shop that sells clothes.

Cosistence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to be sold

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a resident of the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. Constance owns a retail shop that she has been running for one year. Constance began this business from a loan she obtained from a friend. She also works in tailoring.

She learned about Milango Financial Services from other clients, and joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are the high cost of stock and competition.

Constance is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, and charcoal. The extra income from this loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living conditions. She aspires to own other centers and plan for her child’s education with much security.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, jewellery, underwear, shoes and others things

loans.name: Wyckliff

texts.en:
Wyckliff is 22 years old. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He grows maize, beans, cassava and bananas, and he also has cows and goats.

Wyckliff looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the tools in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to communicate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Wyckliff will save up to buy more land. His biggest dream is to own a building in town.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 42 años, convive con Julio. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Digna, Waderle y Analy.Ellos habitan un hogar sencillo en un distrito rural de la selva central. De carácter perseverante y tenaz, Marleni hace 12 años se dedica a la siembra de café. Con la ayuda de su esposo, siembra, abona y cultiva, posteriormente, después de los cuidados, los comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced.  
Lo que más le gusta a Marleni, es poder estar activa y trabajar sin parar, “me siento útil”, asegura. Por ello, cuando tienen la oportunidad, trabaja en diferentes haciendas, donde limpia la maleza que crece entre los cultivos. Segura de que podrá salir adelante, está planeando renovar sus plantaciones, con los viveros de café que ya muy pronto estarán listos para ser trasplantados.
Ella requiere de su ayuda una vez más, ya que la temporada de fertilización de los cultivos se acercó y no quiere quedarse atrás. Piensa comprar varias bolsas de abono orgánico. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la confianza que depositaron en ella nuevamente. 
Marleni, tiene el cafetal algo descuidado, por ello comprará con el dinero, varias bolsas de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Marleni is 42, she lives with Julio.  They had three children: Digna, Waderle and Analy.  they live in a simple home in a rural district of the central jungle.  With her persistent and tenacious personality, Marleni has grown coffee for the last 12 years.  With her husband's help she seeds, fertilizes and grows coffee to later on, sell it in the city of La Merced.

What Marleni likes the most is being able to stay active and work non-stop, "I feel useful" she assures.  This is why when they have the opportunity, they work in different haciendas, where they clean weeds that grow in the crops.  She is confident that she will be able to get ahead, so she is planning to renew her field with the coffee plants from the green house that soon will be ready to be transfered.

She requests your help once more, because the fertilizing season for the plantation is near and she doesn't want to fall behind.  She plans to buy several bags of organic fertilizer.  She belongs to the community bank "Unity becomes strength for the doves" and this is the third loan with MFP where she is thankful for the trust that they placed in her again.  Marleni's coffee plantation is a bit neglected that's why she will buy with the money several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Shaqir

texts.en:
Shaqir is 22 years old. He is married and has one child who is four years old. They live in a minority community in very poor conditions. As the main source of income for his family, Shaqir performs at weddings. He typically has a lot of work during the summer. His wife is a housewife, staying home to care for the house and their child. Shaqir is in need of a loan in order to paint the interior of the house and to renovate its exterior walls. 

This loan will help Shaqir’s family to have better living conditions. In the future, he hopes to improve his family's living conditions more and to save money for his child's education. He promises to pay back the loan on time, and wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to paint the inside of his house and renovate its exterior walls

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vincent is 27 years old, and is married with one child. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans and coffee. They also have chickens and pigs. 

Vincent wants to become a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the tools in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scales) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Vincent will invest in exotic livestock breeds in order to grow his farming business. He dreams of helping the youth of his village to learn about farming.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scales so he can provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Thadeus

texts.en:
Thadeus is 32 years old. He is married with seven children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans and cassava. They also have cows and chickens. 

Thadeus wants to become a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the tools in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scales) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Thadeus will save to buy more dairy cows to increase his family's income. He dreams of seeing all of his children receive a university education. He would like to be a model farmer for his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scales so he can provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 32 years old, and married with three children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow maize, beans, vegetables, groundnuts, sunflowers and bananas. They also keep goats, chickens and pigs. 

Sylivia wants to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scales) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Sylivia will invest in her farm. She dreams of becoming a successful commercial farmer and seeing her children receive a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scales so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 20 years old, and married with six children.  With two children in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, sugar, milk and soap. 

Arlene has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk and soap.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es un mujer de 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposo y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a su padres, Catalina no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar unos riquísimos Pallares con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace varios años Catalina de dedica a la agricultura, ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde cultiva uva, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana con ayuda de su esposo inician su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
Catalina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mantenimiento, riesgo y cosecha de su cultivo; de esta manera Catalina tendrá su cultivo en mejores condiciones, asegurando así que su cosecha se logre satisfactoriamente, con ello espera poder realizar una buena venta y aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina, 56, lives in the city of Ica with her husband and two kids, whom she loves and who are her principal reason for living. She is friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic. Together with her husband they work hard to get their family ahead. Unfortunately, due to the need to work from a very young age to support her parents, Catalina was not able to study a career, but she would have liked to have done so. In her free time she likes to cook a delicious meal of Pallares con Seco [Lima beans with dried meat] to share with her family.

With a lot of hard work and enthusiasm, some years ago Catalina began farming. She has a small piece of land where she grows grapes. Every day she starts work very early, with help from her husband. She works about 10 hours a day and thinks it's going well because of her enthusiasm and dedication to her work. 

Catalina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support she will be able to cover the costs of maintenance, irrigation and harvesting of her crop. In this way, Catalina's crop will be in better condition, ensuring that she'll have a satisfactory harvest. She hopes to have good sales and increase her income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain, irrigate and harvest her crop.

loans.name: Celna

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Celna works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling other food.  Celna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Celna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is widow, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Edna has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soap and shampoo. 

Edna has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Redemption

texts.en:
Redemption is a 41-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol, and mother of four children. She has run a fishing business together with her husband for more than 15 years now.

Redemption is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and fuel for the boat. Through this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market.

In the future, Redemption hopes to expand their business and save money for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Edna requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as noodles, sugar, and spices.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as noodles, sugar, and spices

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a 48-year-old married woman, and has operated a fishing business for more than twenty years. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Consolacion helps her husband make fish traps; she also sells his catch at the market. Consolacion is requesting a loan to buy fish nets and materials for making fish traps. This will help her husband catch more fish, allowing them to sell more at the market. 

Consolacion dreams of making their business successful and saving money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy nets and buckets for storage

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
This is Filipina. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. The profits from her business will help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Filipina hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business.She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies for her computer rental shop.

loans.name: Armend

texts.en:
Armend is twenty four years old and married with one child. He comes from a vulnerable community in Kosovo. For more than a year now he has run his own cafe and billiard business. He has had a lot of profit from his business, and it is the main income for his family.

Armend is now asking for a loan to buy new furniture such as tables and chairs. The loan will help to increase his profits by creating a better environment for his customers. He hopes in the future to have more profits, because of the experience he will have running the business.

Armend's goal is to improve his living conditions and to grow his business. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy new furniture such as tables and chairs

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 35 years old, and lives at West Point with her child who is 19 years old, and a friend. She left school in the 7th grade, and has been managing her business for the past three years.

She has a shop where she sells fashion dresses, skirts, and blouses. She learned to sell from her mother, and started this business with the small amount of 30,000 Liberian Dollars (LRD).  Bendu makes a profit when she sells, because of the good interaction she has with her customers, and the quality materials that she sells. One of the difficulties she faces is the exchange rate of the Liberian dollars to the US Dollar. 

She has asked for a loan to buy more fashion dresses, blouses, and skirts to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her child, and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fashion dresses, blouses, and skirts to increase her sales.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 27-year-old married man with 3 children. He describes himself as focused and business-oriented man. He has run a farm for five years where  he grows and sells kale. His business is located on agricultural land, and his primary customers are local residents. 

Alfred says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the 11,100 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to purchase a water tank, which will be used by his five family members. His business goal is to diversify his business to horticultural farming, and to open a new retail shop within five years selling household items to local residents. He hopes that in the future, he will have grown his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, after the previous one of KES 20,000, which he managed to repay succesfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Chriss

texts.es: Chriss tiene 29 años, está casada con Ángel. Ambos tienen una hermosa hija Angelis de 3 años. Ellos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural. Chriss es una joven de convicciones planteadas. Se dedica a la agricultura. El trabajo arduo en el sembrío, abonamiento y cosecha, es el compromiso que asumió Chriss hace 10 años; pues según afirma desde muy niña, gusto del campo y producir la tierra, ahora ella tiene más de 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra plátanos a gran escala, los cuales cosecha 2 veces al mes. Lo que más le gusta a Chriss, es poder negociar sus ricos plátanos por medio de los intermediarios, los cuales gustosos le aconsejas nuevos mercados donde ella puede expandirse y poder ofrecer sus frutos. Por ello más adelante desea convertirse en una agricultora reconocida. Hace 1 año cuenta con una parcela de cafetales, los que cuida con esmero, para cosecharlos y venderlos. Con la ayuda de su esposo, está segura que conseguirá sus metas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el tecer crédito con MFP, donde espera salir adelante junto a su banco comunal que constan de personas comprometidas con el progreso. Con el dinero podrá adquirir varias bolsas de abono orgánico para mantener con cuidados a sus cultivos de plátanos y café.
texts.en: Chriss is 29, married to Angel.  They have a beautiful daughter named Angelis who is three years old.  They live in a house they own located in a rural area. Chriss is a young woman of deep convictions.  She works in agriculture.  It's hard work to do seeding, fertilizing and harvest, a commitment Chriss took on 10 years ago; according to her she liked the land and rural life since she was little, she now has more than two hectares of land where she plants bananas and harvests twice a month.  What she likes the most is to be able to negotiate her delicious bananas through third parties; who gladly advise her about new markets where she can expand to and offer her fruit.  This is why later on she wants to be recognized as a good farmer. A year ago she also got a plot of land with coffee, she takes good care of it to harvest and sell.  With her husband's help she is confident she will achieve her goals.  She belongs to the community bank "Unity becomes strength for the doves" and this is the third loan with MFP, where she hopes to get ahead together with the community bank with members committed to move forward.  With the money from the loan she will buy several bags of organic fertilizer to take care of her plantations of bananas and coffee.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yuly

texts.es:
Yuly tiene 40 años, es una luchadora madre soltera de 3 hijos: Luisa, Katy y Alexandra. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural de la selva central. Yuly es emprendedora y aguerrida. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, con el cultivo de café, plátanos, kión, paltas, cocos y otros. Pero considera que el producto que mayor satisfacción le genera es el café, por ello también destina mayor capital en sus cuidados.
Sus hijas son su inspiración, por eso no descansa. Cada vez que cosecha los plátanos, cocos y kión, viaja hasta la ciudad de La Merced, donde ofrece sus productos. Con lo obtenido puede comprar lo necesario para consumir y vestir.
Hace poco inició con la limpieza de sus cultivos de café, pero menciona que también le hace falta fertilizantes orgánicos para que los granos sean más grandes y fuertes. Por esa razón solicita de su apoyo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se muestra muy entusiasta con el trabajo que desempeñara junto a los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. Yuly con el dinero podrá comprar como 20 bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos y podrá pagar a los jornaleros quienes la apoyarán en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Yuly is 40, a hardworking single mom of three: Luisa, Katy and Alexandra.  She and her family live in a house they own located in a rural area of the central jungle.  Yuly is enterprising and brave.  Her main activity is agriculture, she plants coffee, bananas, ginger, avocados, coconuts and other.  She considers that the product that gives her more satisfaction is coffee, that's also why she allocates more capital to its care.
Her daughters are her inspiration, but she doesn't rest.  Every time she harvests bananas, coconuts and ginger; she travels to the city of La Merced where she offers her products.  With what she gets she can afford food and clothing.
Not long ago she started cleaning the coffee plantation, but she also needs organic fertilizer so that the beans are stronger and bigger.  This is why she requests your support.  She belongs to the community bank "Unity becomes strength for the doves" and this is her third loan with MFP; she seems enthusiastic with the work she will do with the other members of the community bank.  With the money Yuly will buy 20 bags of organic fertilizer for her plantation and she will be able to pay the journeymen that help her with this activity.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 66 years old and married with ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, soap, and eggs.

Emma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns income from raising pigs.

Emma aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, soap, and eggs

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years, and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store including shampoo, soap, sugar, and milk.

Flordeliz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as shampoo, soap, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a projector.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Emily Selene

texts.es:
Emily es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 3 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razono en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Emily no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias a las enseñanzas de su Madre, Emily trabaja como confeccionista de prendas de vestir de lana, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque cuenta con buenos clientes que siempre acuden a ella.
Emily se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sus materiales de trabajo, tales como lanas y agujas en mayor cantidad, de esta manera Emily podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose, para así poder lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda, la cual brinde mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Emily is a 20-year-old girl, lives in the city of Pisco with her husband and their three-year-old daughter who she loves and her main priority in life.  She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person that together with her husband dedicated all their efforts to get their family ahead; unfortunately due to low financial resources and for the need to work Emily wasn't able to study a professional degree of Business. 
Through her own initiative and with hard work and dedication thanks to her mother's teachings, Emily works as a tailor of wool items,  she works every day since early in the morning and can work for approximately 12 hours, she feels good working on this and thinks she does well because she has good customers that keep coming to her.
Emily is thankful to the Kiva lenders, thanks to their help she will be able to buy working materials such as wool and needles, this way Emily will be able to continue working hard, to be able to achieve a dream to finish building her house, which now has better security for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy working materials such as needles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her hair studio.

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
Dany tiene 40 años convive con Richard. Ambos tienen una hija Mayeri, de 12 años. Ellos habitan un hogar sencillo pero propio ubicado en un distrito rural de la selva central.
Dany es muy empeñosa y constante. Se dedica al sembrío de café, donde todos los fines de semana, después de una ardua labor en el jardín de niños donde enseña. Se encamina a su comunidad donde cuida, abonan, y retira la maleza que crece entre sus sembríos. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder dedicar tiempo y esfuerzo a algo propio, por ello en cada cosecha comercializa sus granos de café, en una cooperativa de su zona. Dany, no se dedica únicamente a ello, pues hace 4 años, comenzó como promotora educativa en el servicio social del estado peruano, que consta de enseñar a leer, escribir y mejorar la psicomotrosidad de niños mayores de tres años. Ahora está trabajando en la mejora de sus cultivos, para poder obtener mejores resultados en su comercialización. Por ahora se esmerará en el cuidado de su cafetal, con la compra de abono orgánico. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP; donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para el logro de sus objetivos. Dice que será puntual en las cuotas.
Dany invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus viveros de café.
texts.en:
Dany is 40 years old and lives with Richard. Together they have a daughter, Mayeri, who is 12 years old. They live in a simple home, but it is their own; it’s located in a rural district in the central forest. 

Dany is very determined and persevering woman. She works growing coffee every weekend, after hard work in the kindergarten where she teaches. She goes out to her community where she raises, fertilizes, and removes the weeds that grow between her plants. She’s already been working in agriculture for 5 years, and what she likes most about it is being able to dedicate time and effort to something of her own. Because of this, from each harvest, she sells her coffee beans in a cooperative in her area.

Dany doesn’t only do this work; 4 years ago, she became an educational organizer in the Peruvian state social services, where she teaches reading, writing, and improvement of psychomotor activity to children older than three years. 

Now, she is working on improving her crops in order to obtain better results in her sales. For now, she is doing her best to care for her coffee plantation with the purchase of organic fertilizer. She belongs to the communal bank “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” and this is the third loan with MFP, where she hopes for a small loan for the success of her goals. She says that she will be punctual in her payments. Dany will invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread among her coffee seedbeds.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 60 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Helen has a business of buying and selling coconut/dried coconut meat in the Philippines. Helen requested a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

Helen has been in this business for six years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 39 years old and is from Bocator, Tangub City. She is married and blessed with two children. 

Editha is working as a chief baker to help the family to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns about 15,000 Php (Philippines pesos) per month. 

In 2011, Editha joined GDMPC. She requested a loan in the amount of Php 25,000 to purchase new baking equipment and tools to expand the business. Editha plans that the income generated from her loan will be invested back into the business and ultimately hopes to expand the size of the business. Additionally, Editha hopes that continued success in her business will allow her to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new baking equipment and tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her nipa business.

Janet has been in this business for 10 years. Janet earns more income from being a fish pond operator.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) to sell.

loans.name: Desire

texts.en:
Desire is 36 years old, is married and has four children between the ages ten and five years. He currently employs one person to help him. He has three years of experience in this work. 

Desire has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more cassava flour for resale. With the profit from the loan, Desire will satisfy his family's basic needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo, Leoncio se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta asistir a la Iglesia para agradecer a Dios por toda su ayuda brindada y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Leoncio trabaja brindando servicios de vigilancia y limpieza en diversas empresas de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable con su trabajo.
Leoncio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder tener un trabajo adicional brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, de esta manera Leoncio seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 22 and single; he lives in the city of Chiclayo. He is a friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic young man who is very ambitious. Due to his hard work, he is currently studying Engineering Systems. During his free time he likes to attend church to thank God for all of his help, and occasionally he cooks delicious fried rice to share with his family.

Through dedication and his own initiative, Leonicio works as a security guard and cleaner at various businesses in the city. He works every day from the early hours in the morning and typically works about eight hours. He is comfortable while at work and believes he does well becuase he is very responsible. 

Leonicio is very thankful to Kiva lenders because due to their support he has been able to buy a mototaxi. This will provide him an additional job transporting people throughout the city. Leonicio will contiue working and striving to achieve his dream of becoming a good professional and improve his life.

loans.use: purchase a taxi (motorcycle)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 48 años, está casada con Herminio. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas Merly, de 15 años. Esta familia vive unida en un hogar propio en un anexo de la selva central.
Carmen es una mujer vital y muy activa en sus labores. Cuenta que hace 9 años se dedica a la agricultura; donde sus principales sembríos constan de café, plátanos, y palta. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder sacar el quillo (tipo de maleza que crece entre los cultivos) que crece constantemente, pues así asegura que sus cultivos crecerán sin mayores inconvenientes. El trabajo esforzado que diariamente proporciona a sus cultivos principalmente de plátanos, hace que 2 veces al mes viaje a las ciudades de La Merced y Villa Rica, donde vende sus frutos. Pero como sabe que las épocas de cosecha de café son una vez al año, ella desea mejorar e incrementar la siembra de diferentes frutas, así está segura que no tendrá inconvenientes en su economía. Por ahora se prepara para la raspa de café (recolección de los últimos granos maduros), donde espera obtener buenas ganancias. Ahora tiene pensado pagar a jornaleros que contratará para que atiendan sus cultivos.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. 
Carmen destinará el dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos, con lo sobrante comprará bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Carmen, 48, is married to Herminio and they have four children.  Their 15-year-old daughter, Merly, is the only one who still lives at home.  They own the home they live in which is next to the central forest.

Carmen is very dynamic and active in her work.  For nine years she has been farming crops, with the main ones being coffee, bananas and avocado.  What she enjoys most is removing the weeds that grow constantly, because that ensures her crops can grow better.  The daily hard work she puts into growing bananas means she must travel twice a month to the cities of La Merced and Villa Rica where she sells her produce.  But since she knows the coffee harvest season is only once a year she wants to improve and expand into growing different crops so she does not run into economic problems.  Now she is preparing to harvest the last coffee beans that she hopes will give her a good profit.  She plans to hire workers to take care of the crops.

She belongs to the communal bank "La unión hace la fuerza del palomar" and this is her third loan through MFP.  She hopes to count on your help to meet her goals.

Carmen will use the money to hire workers to clear her cropland and to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire workers.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 50 años, convive con Jaime. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Karina y Juan. Esta familia habita una casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural. Sonia es una mujer atenta y carismática. Desde muy niña, incursionó en la agricultura, ahí, gracias a sus padres pudo aprender las técnicas de cultivo, como también a tener buen tacto en la manera de comercializar sus cosechas. Ahora ella tiene más de 22 años sembrando sus propios frutos, que constan de plátanos, palta, café, rocoto y kion; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues no quiere defraudar las enseñanzas de sus padres; su esfuerzo y constancia, hacen que Sonia, venda sus cosechas a buen precio; tanto así que en temporadas agrícolas, los comerciantes que visitan la zona, ofrecen por sus cultivos mayor precio de venta, por ello está planeando mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, para comenzar a vender su grano a los exportadores de café. Ahora piensa realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos y esparcirles fertilizantes orgánicos, para ello requiere de su ayuda. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para el cumplimiento de sus objetivos. Sonia realizará la limpieza de sus cultivos, para ello invertirá el dinero en el pago a los jornaleros, además comprará bolsas de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Sonia, 50, and her common-law husband, Jaime, have six children; but only two still live at home; Karina and Juan.  The family lives in their own house in the rural district.  Sonia is a very attentive, charismatic woman who has been involved in farming since she was a little girl.  Her parents taught her the technique of crop-farming and also how to be good at selling her produce.  For 22 years now she has been growing her own crops (bananas, avocados, coffee, pepper and ginger), which she cares for with hard work because she would not want to disappoint her parents.  Sonia's effort and consistency allow her to sell her produce at a good price, and merchants visit the area to put in their highest bid for her crops.  Therefore, she is planning to improve crop quality begin selling coffee to exporters.

Now she wants to clean the cropland and spread around organic fertilizer, but she needs help.  She belongs to the communal bank "La Unión hace la fuerza del palomar" and this is her third loan through MFP.  She is counting on your help to meet her goals.  Sonia plans to clean her cropland and use the loan to hire workers and buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire workers and buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica works hard to support her family; she is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell such as sugar, milk, shampoo, etc. Jessica has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell such as sugar, milk, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, she manages a fishpond where she raises fish, crabs and shrimp for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Mary Jane joined GDMPC. Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, con visión de negocio y muy trabajadora, está casada con César y junto a él tiene 4 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a sus padres, sus hijos, su esposo, y sus nietos. 
El trabajo de Bernardina, consiste en el alquiler de vehículos de transporte público. Tiene 4 mototaxis los cuales alquila diariamente a sus choferes que acuden a su vivienda para solicitar la herramienta de trabajo. Recibe un pago por brindar este servicio y las ganancias que recibe le permiten cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Algunas veces son sus hijos o hermanos quienes conducen los vehículos y en ocasiones jóvenes de su barrio que ella conoce muy bien. Todos sus vehículos están en buen estado aunque la documentación de circulación de algunos de ellos ya está por vencerse. Lleva en esta actividad más de 20 años y empezó desde cero, poniéndole siempre optimismo y mucho ahínco a todo lo que hace. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede compartir el tiempo a lado de su familia y dedicarse a otras actividades de su hogar, además de poder generar ingresos económicos que necesita para enfrentar el día a día en su vivienda, le va bien hasta ahora, espera poder seguir así para que  flota de vehículos se incremente.
Este es el crédito número 11 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará seguro para dos mototaxis y renovará algunas piezas y repuestos de uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 52, is a hard-working, enterprising woman with a vision for business.  She is married to César and they have four adult children.  The family, grandparents and grandchildren all live together in their own house.

Bernardina rents public transportation vehicles for a living.  She owns four motor-taxis that she rents to different drivers who come to the house to hire their working vehicle.  The income she earns from this allows her to cover basic household expenses.  Sometimes it is her own children or brothers who drive the vehicles and other times it is neighborhood youth who she knows very well.  All of her vehicles are kept in good condition, but the circulation permit on some of them is about to expire.  

She has been in business for 20 years and started out from scratch with a lot of optimism and determination.  What she likes most about her work is that it allows her to spend time with the family and take care of other household activities.  She also generates extra income for the daily running of the household.  Business has been going well until now, so she hopes to continue in this vein and expand her fleet.

This is her 11th loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support she receives there, which helps her to continue increasing her work capital.  She plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy insurance for two of her motor-taxis and spare parts for one of them.

loans.use: To buy insurance for two of her moto-taxis and spare parts for one of them.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité San Miguel es de la ciudad de Lambaré, está integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras, que se esmeran por ir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Patricia, la presidenta es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora, trabaja todos los días en su puesto y es gracias a su trabajo que ella está saliendo adelante y puede ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda donde pueda tener más prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito, para la compra de remeras, pantalones, jeans y demás prendas, con lo que desea seguir atrayendo a más clientes y ganar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Miguel is located in the city of Lambaré and comprised of 15 hard-working women who put every effort into growing their businesses and helping their families.

Patricia, the president of the group, is a very enterprising, determined woman who works every day at her job.  Thanks to her work she is able to get ahead and help her family.  Her goal is to have a large shop some day where she can offer more clothing to her customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy capris, pants, jeans and other clothing so she can continue to attract more customers and earn more money.

loans.use: To buy capris, pants, jeans and other clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en: Edelina is separated and has one child. She is 45 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Edelina raises corn for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In 2011, Edelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Edelina hopes to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Nerizza

texts.en:
Nerizza, 37, is a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Henry and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a variety store. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She buy supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 42,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Nerizza hopes her daughter will finish her studies and dreams to have a new house and lot through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés, de 47 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 11 años, vive en su casa propia junto a los miembros de su familia, ella trabaja a diario para poder dar lo mejor a su hijo y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre. El trabajo de Inés, consiste principalmente en la venta de comida. Tiene su puesto de ventas ubicado en concurrido mercado de la ciudad y ahí ofrece diariamente los más deliciosos platillos regionales como pescados asados, chorizos, pollo y otros que caracterizan la comida peruana como “ají de gallina”, “lomo saltado” y “arroz con pollo””. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano y culmina aproximadamente a las 3 de la tarde. Lleva realizando este negocio más de 7 años con la ayuda incondicional de su cónyuge. Paralelamente tiene un puesto contiguo de pasamanería en el cual atiende principalmente su pareja y ella solo apoya cuando no tiene clientes en su puesto de comida. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que desarrolla una labor que le fascina desde muy pequeña, siempre cocinó y le agrada ahora ponerlo en práctica como una oportunidad de negocio, además gracias a este trabajo tiene buenos ingresos económicos que le sirven para solventar los gastos de su hogar y brindarles las comodidades necesarias a su familia. Este es el préstamo número 8 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos utilizados en la preparación de sus potajes como aceites, arroz, verduras, tubérculos, condimentos carnes y otros productos, además otra parte del dinero lo usará en la compra de diversos artículos de pasamanería para venderlos en la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Inés, 47, is a cheerful, dynamic woman who lives with her common-law husband and 11-year-old son in their own home.  She works every day to provide her son with all she can and give her mother a better quality of life.  Inés has a food stall at the busy city market where she sells delicious regional dishes such as baked fish, chorizos, chicken and other Peruvian food such as chili pepper chicken, sauteed beef tenderloin, and chicken and rice.  

She starts work very early in the morning and ends her day at 3:00 p.m.  She has been in business for over seven years with the unconditional help of her husband.  She also has another stall next door, run mainly by her husband, where she sells decorative trimmings.  She helps out there when she is not busy at the other stall.  

What she enjoys about her work is that she can earn a living cooking, which she has always loved to do ever since she was a child. It provides a good income to help cover household expenses and give her family basic comforts. 

This is her eighth loan through MFP and she is very grateful for the opportunity and financial support she needs to get ahead.  She will use the 3,000 PEN to buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her stews, such as oils, rice, vegetables, tubers, condiments, meat and other products.  Part of the money will also be used to buy different decorative items for the Christmas season to sell at the other stall.

loans.use: To buy oils, rice, vegetables, tubers, condiments, meat and other products.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо проживает в городе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 27 лет. У нее один ребенок. Точинисо предоставляет услугу. Она занимается шитьем платьев, в основном национальных платьев. Точинисо принимает заказы у себя дома. В этой области она четыре года. Точинисо берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки и ремонта своего дома.
texts.en: Tojiniso lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 27 years old and is married with one child.  Tojiniso offers a service selling dresses, mainly national costumes.  She has been in this line of work for four years and takes dress orders in her own home.  Tojiniso is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine and to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and make repairs on her home.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Pora Group

texts.es:
16  señoras humildes con el propósito de obtener una para seguir trabajando se unieron y forman el grupo Kuña Aty Pora. Ellas desean una superación personal por el bienestar de sus familias.
Natividad es parte del grupo, ella tiene una despensa en su casa, y cuenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas y que así mantiene a su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y cuenta que de a poco y por medio de su arduo trabajo está creciendo y saliendo adelante.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder surtir su negocio con todo tipo de productos, como ser bebidas, lácteos, carnes, artículos a granel y demás, ya que son los que mas salida tienen y quiere tener siempre surtido su negocio, ya que eso atrae a clientes y mantiene a los que ya tiene.
texts.en:
Sixteen women joined together to form the group “Kuña Aty Pora” in hopes of working together in order to continue their businesses. They all want to succeed on a personal level and provide for the welfare of their families.

Natividad, a member of this group, manages a food pantry in her home. Every day she begins her work in the early morning hours so that she can support her family. She is a hardworking and enterprising individual. Even though she has very little, Natividad works very hard to continue growing and moving forward.

She is requesting assistance so that she can restock her business with all types of products, such as beverages, dairy goods, meats, bulk items, and other merchandise. These products are what she sells the most, so she always wants to keep her business stocked with these items. This will help her attract new customers and maintain the ones she already has.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy goods, meats, bulk items, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años, convive con Luis, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo vive con tres de ellos: Martín, Rosario y Luis. Ellos habitan una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural de la selva central. María se dedica a la agricultura. Gracias a sus perseverancia y tenacidad logró que su comunidad le otorgué 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. María, se esfuerza mucho por mantener la unión familiar y apoyar en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos a su esposo Luis, quien afirma que desde que consolidaron una familia, hace ya 21 años; comenzaron a sembrar café y plátanos; hasta hoy el apoyo que obtiene de ella, lo motiva, “ella es muy hábil para la venta”, asegura. María, después de cada cosecha, comercializa su fruto de plátanos en la ciudad de La Merced, pero su grano de café los vende en la cooperativa de su comunidad. Pero como socios, María, está feliz de poder tener el apoyo constante de su esposo, juntos desean trabajar con ahínco para la mejora de sus sembríos, y de esa manera incrementar su producción. María desea sembrar más semillas de café y preparar viveros de café, para ello requiere de su apoyo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus planes. Asimismo se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para fortificar su vivero de café, así como elaborar otros, para posteriores plantaciones.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and lives with her husband Luis.  The couple have six children but only live with three of them: Martín, Rosario and Luis.  They live in their own home which is located in a small rural community in the central jungle.

María's business is farming.  Thanks to her perseverance and tenacity, she managed to receive 3 hectares of farmland from her community.  María works very hard to keep her family together and to support her husband, Luis, in maintaining their crops.  Luis says that when they first formed their family, 21 years ago, they started growing coffee and bananas.  The support that he receives from María motivates him.  "She is very skillful in making sales", he says.  After every harvest, María sells their bananas in the city of La Merced.  They sell their coffee beans through the cooperative in their community.  As partners, María is happy to have the constant support of her husband.  Together they would like to work hard to improve their plantings so that they can increase their production.  María would like to sow more coffee seeds and prepare coffee nurseries but she needs your support for this.

María is a member of “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” community bank and this is her third loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can continue with her plans.  She pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.

With your support, María will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer to strengthen her coffee nursery and to create more seedlings for future planting.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Esperanza"tiene mas de 2 años de formación y trabajo con la fundación, son 12 las mujeres que trabajan en este grupo y están saliendo adelante por medio de la ayuda que se dan las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Ester es una  integrante de este comité , se unió al grupo por la necesidad de tener un un medio que le permita generar mas ingresos , se dedica a la venta de ropas nuevas y usadas, y está creciendo ya que las prendas cada vez más están con mejor venta. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días .
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, de todo tipo para poder surtirse y tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) committee has been up and running and working with Fundación Paraguaya for two years.  There are 12 women in this group and they are making progress through the help that they provide to each other. 

Ester is one of the members of this group.  She joined as she needed a way to make more income.  Her business is selling new and used clothing and her business is growing as her sales are improving.  She longs for a better future for her children and this is why she works hard every day.

Ester is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothing so that she can stock up and have a good range available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Renovadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Renovadoras" tiene 2 años de trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, sus integrantes son 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, donde todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que desean salir adelante y crecer para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes de éste comité, es vendedora ambulante de remedios naturales y también realiza reciclaje de materiales como ser aluminio, plásticos, papel , hierro, etc.  Dice la Sra. Maria que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de remedios naturales, con los que va a poder surtirse y tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Todas las miembros están contentas por formar parte de este grupo ya que les ha ayudado mucho.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Renovadoras" committee has been working with Fundación Paraguaya for two years.  Twelve women from the city of Asunción belong to this group.  They are all very hard-working women who would like to make progress and grow their businesses so that they can help their families.

Maria is one of the members of this committee.  Her business is selling natural medicines as an itinerant vendor.  She also recycles materials such as aluminum, plastic, paper, iron, etc.  She says that she is working hard and, as a result, making progress and helping her family. 

Maria is requesting this loan to buy natural medicines so that she can stock up and thereby have a better range to offer her customers.  All the members are happy to belong to this group as it has helped them a lot.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира жительница города Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 37 лет. У нее трое детей. Эльмира занимается торговлей более пяти лет. Вот уже три года как она открыла собственный магазин. На сегодняшний день у нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Эльмира берет кредит для приобретения новогодних подарков и сувениров.
texts.en: Elmira lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 37 years old and is married with three children.  Elmira has been a shopkeeper for more than five years.  She opened her own shop three years ago and now she offers a mixed assortment of goods.  Elmira is asking for a loan to buy New Year's gifts and souvenirs.

loans.use: to buy New Year's gifts and souvenirs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa vive  en la cuidad de Santaní, tiene una despensa en su casa, y nos dice que cuenta ya con una clientela formada. Además de eso comenta que su esposo se dedica a distribuir bebidas en la localidad de Guayaibi y alrededores. 
Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que día a día busca mejor la estabilidad de su familia, ya que ella y su marido quieren lo mejor para ellos y por eso se esfuerzan. La meta de Teresa es poder seguir creciendo y agrandando su local.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, frutas, leche, verduras y otros insumos para poder abastecer su despensa.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in the city of Santaní and has a food pantry in her home. She says that she has an established clientele. In addition, Teresa states that her husband is a beverage distributor in the town of Guayaibi and the surrounding areas.

She is an enterprising person who looks to provide better stability for her family each day. Teresa and her husband want to provide the best for their family, so they strive to make this happen. Her goal is to continue growing and expanding her shop.

Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of beverages, vegetables, fruits, milk, and other products to keep her food pantry stocked.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables, fruits, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
El Señor Nery tiene 61 años, está casado desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene hijos mayores de edad, y viven en su propia casa de la ciudad de Encarnación.
El Señor  es comerciante hace mas de 30 años tiene 2 locales comerciales de Casa de deporte muy conocida en la Ciudad. Una es atendida por su esposa y el otro local lo atiende el Señor. Tiene mucha clientela ya que son vendedores mayoristas y distribuyen a grandes comercios, además son fabricantes de ropas deportivas ya que tienen su propio taller. Gracias a esta actividad ellos han podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto y pudieron criar a sus hijos.
El Sr. Nery solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, ya que quiere hacer mas prendas deportivas para poder surtir su negocio y seguir ganando mas clientela.
texts.en:
Sr. Nery is 61 years old and has been married for quite some time. His children are grown. Nery and his family live in their own house in the city of Encarnación. He has been a merchant for more than 30 years and has two sportswear shops that are well-known in the city. His wife manages one shop and he manages the other. Being that they are wholesale vendors, Nery and his wife have many clients and distribute their products to large retailers. In addition, they have their own workshop where they manufacture sportswear. Thanks to their business, Nery and his wife have been able to move forward, maintain their home, cover unplanned expenses, and provide for their children.

Sr. Nery is requesting a loan so that he can buy more fabric. He wants to produce more sportswear so that he can restock his business and continue gaining more clients.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making sportswear.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old, married, and has children. She is from Poblacion, Bonifacio. To make a living, Conchita grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for four years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. 

Conchita joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en: Jovy is a 39-year old resident of Poblacion, Pana-on.  Jovy helps her family from the small amount of 4,000 PHP she earns monthly from her gardening business that she has had for the past 3 years. However in 2011 she became a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan from GDMPC micro finance of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Jovy wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía, de 49 años, es una mujer sencilla y muy responsable, es muy valiente y luchadora ya que tiene la fuerza para poder seguir hacia adelante. Aún siendo madre soltera, ella tiene 1 hijo de 25 años, tiene su casa propia que la comparte actualmente con una amiga y sus 2 hijos pequeños ya que su el suyo es independiente y vive en otro lugar. El trabajo de Lucía consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi. Tiene un vehículo que compró hace algunos años. A diario acude a su casa un conductor quien se encarga de hacer circular su vehículo por las principales calles de la ciudad, por dicho alquiler recibe un monto económico todos los días que le ayuda a cubrir algunas necesidades en su hogar. Ésta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años. Como actividad complementaria se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, ahí también emplea su mototaxi como vehículo de carga cuando tiene algún pedido a zonas alejadas. 
Por el momento, le agrada alquilar su mototaxi porque eso le permite usar su tiempo libre para realizar eventualmente otros trabajos lo que genera que sus ingresos económicos también mejoren, ahora se siente tranquila por todo lo que está consiguiendo y espera en un futuro consolidar una empresa formal en ambos trabajos que emprende. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo..
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará seguro para  su vehículo, además refaccionará otro mototaxi comprando algunos repuestos que necesita para su adecuado funcionamiento.
texts.en:
49-year-old Lucía is a very modest and responsible person.  She is a very courageous and hard-working woman who has the strength to keep moving forward even though she is a single mother with a 25-year-old daughter.  Lucía has her own home which she currently shares with a friend and her friend's two young children as her own daughter lives independently elsewhere.

Lucía's business is renting out a motorcycle taxi.  She has a vehicle that she bought some years ago.  Every day a driver, who drives her vehicle through the main streets of the city, comes to her house and pays her a sum of money which she uses to cover some of her household needs.  Lucía has been in this business for five years.  In addition, she also has a business buying and selling chickens.  She uses her motorcycle taxi to transport her goods when she receives orders from remote areas.

Right now, Lucía enjoys renting out her motorcycle taxi because it allows her to devote her free time to doing other work which improves her income.  She feels happy with everything that she is accomplishing and hopes, in the future, to create a formal business from the two jobs she does.

This is Lucía's fourth loan from MFP.  She is very happy with the financial support that she is receiving as she feels certain that she will make progress in her work.

Lucía will use her 1,500 soles to take out insurance for her vehicle.  She will also refurbish another motorcycle taxi, buying some spare parts that she needs for it to work properly.

loans.use: to buy insurance for her vehicle and to refurbish another motorcycle taxi, buying some spare parts that it needs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of corn to resell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is a 32-year-old married woman with three children.  She resides in Poblacion, Bonifacio. Luzminda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for 3 years.  Each month, she earns 4,000.00 PHP doing this type of work.  She requested a loan of 10,000.00 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.  In 2011, Luzminda joined GDMPC.  In the future, Luzminda wants to build a house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 22 years old and married with 1 child. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes (snow cones) in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy foam cups, sacks of sugar, cordials, etc.  In the future, Sina hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, foam cups, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupy con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 2 ciclo, en forma conjunta dentro del programa, además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, y así se ayudan y tienen un pequeño ahorro para poder afrontar todo lo que pueda surgir.
Una historia es de la Sr. Dionicia, quien es modista, y comenta que por medio de la costura está ayudando a su familia y tiene los medios para procurarles una vida digna sin privaciones.  Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana tener un gran taller de costura.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtirse con telas, hilos, botones y demás.
texts.en:
The 'Kuña Katupy' committee are working very hard together within the program and are in their second loan cycle. In addition to each member's individual work, they also work together as a group.  They help each other and have a small amount of savings which allows them to face any eventualities that may occur.

Dionicia is a seamstress and she says that, through her sewing, she is helping her family.  She has the means necessary to provide them with a decent life free from hardships.  Her dream is to be able to continue growing her business and, in the near future, to have a large sewing workshop.

Dionicia is requesting this loan to stock up on fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Ame Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo numero 14 s encuentra este grupo. Se puede destacar que todas las miembros han puesto todo de su parte por crecer e ir mejorando día a día, es por eso que les está yendo muy bien, progresan ya que siempre se esfuerzan.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Isabel, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropas y venta de milanesa. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que pese a los obstáculos que ha tenido pudo levantarse y seguir adelante, todo sea por el bien de su familia y de los suyos.
Cuenta la Sra. Isabel solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las milanesas y también para la compra de ropas, ya que quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes de ambos trabajos.
texts.en:
This group are on their 14th loan cycle.  Every member of the group has worked as hard as they can so that they continue to grow and improve every day.  They are doing very well and making progress as they always work hard.

One of the members of this group is Isabel, whose business is selling clothing and 'milanesa' (meat fillet fried in breadcrumbs).  She is a very hard-working person who, in spite of the obstacles she has faced, has been able to get up and keep moving forward for the sake of her family.

Isabel says that she is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making her 'milanesas' and also to buy clothing as she would like to be able to satisfy the customers she has for each business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'milanesas' and to buy clothing

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este Comité tiene 18 mujeres quienes forman parte del Comité, ellas son  trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. Las mismas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras, pero también trabajan juntas y así con ese trabajo se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Una de las historias es la de la Sra. Daccy, quien es peluquera. Ella tiene un pequeño salón, con las comodidades necesarias para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio, y así también poder ayudar a su familia. Daccy comenta que por medio de su salón ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante y tener una vida digna.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su negocio, con los insumos que necesita para poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, y demás insumos para poder seguir.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 18 women.  They are all hard-working and humble women who must earn a living every day.  They work independently as saleswomen but also work together and thereby help each other out.

Daccy is a hairdresser.  She owns a small salon which has all the conveniences necessary to offer her customers a good service and thereby help her family.  Daccy says that, through her salon, she has been able to provide her family with everything they need to move forward and enjoy a decent life.

Daccy is requesting this loan to stock her business with the supplies she needs to provide her customers with a good service.  She will buy dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams and other supplies she needs to continue working.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams and other supplies

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилорому 32 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Дилором решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilorom is 32 years old and she is married with three children at home.  She is a very hard-working and goal-oriented woman.  Her husband earns a small salary which is not enough to provide for their family's basic needs.  Dilorom has decided to help her husband for the good of her family.  With this goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Bring It On" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her business and becoming successful in that sphere.  Dilorom wants to start a business buying and selling dried fruits.  With the income from this business, she plans on providing her children with a good education and high-calorie foods.  She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy goods so she can start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for starting her new business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon; she previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more fish and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase more fish and vegetables that are needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.  Corazon hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of god that she studies.
