* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale.  She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She is from Lower Usogan, Bonifacio and been farming for 13 years, earning an amount of 3,000 PHP a month.  In 2010, Vilma joined GDMPC. Vilma is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is 48 years old and married with 10 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Ice Cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy supplies such as foam cups, deep freezer, sugar, etc. In the future, Lisa hopes to improve her business and pay for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, deep freezer, sugar, etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano” se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres tiene 15 integrantes, de la ciudad de Asunción; todas las integrantes se unieron con el objetivo de ir creciendo y ayudando a sus familias.
Deisy la presidenta, comenta que su grupo se esfuerza día a día por salir adelante, ellas se esmeran y están ayudando muy bien a sus familias. Ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de ropas, y le está yendo bien, aunque la competencia es muy dura. Su meta es seguir trabajando para no hacer faltar nada  a su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo ya que quiere poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, pantalones, jeans y demás prendas para poder venderlos.
texts.en:
"San Cayetano" committee is now in its third cycle in the women’s program. It is composed of fifteen members from the city of Asunción. All members joined with the goal of growing and helping their families.

Deisy is the president. She says that her group strives every day to get ahead in life. They all work hard and are giving their families the help they need. On a personal level, Deisy sells clothes. She is doing well, although competition is hard. Her goal is to continue working so that her family has everything they need.

She is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in buying t-shirts, pants, jeans and other garments and sell them.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Bonanza" tiene 2 años de formación, y está integrado por 25 mujeres. Es un grupo bastante numeroso, pero pese a ellos todas las integrantes se llevan muy bien y trabajan juntas para poder ayudarse y darse la mano cuando lo necesitan.
La Sra. Rita es parte de este grupo, ella es vendedora ambulante de comestibles y también realiza reciclaje de materiales como ser aluminio, plásticos, papel, hierro, etc. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada, ya que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y termina ya muy tarde. Esta muy orgullosa de todo lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto, y gracias a lo cual ayuda a su familia.
Rita solicita de este crédito para la compra de aluminio, plásticos, papel, hierro, etc, lo cual podrá revender para poder tener un mayor margen de ganancias. Todas las miembros están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The "Bonanza" committee has been around for two years.  It has 25 female members.  It is quite a large group but, in spite of this fact, all the members get on very well and they work together so that they can help each other and lend a hand whenever it is needed.

Rita is a member of this group.  She sells food as an itinerant street vendor and also works recycling materials such as aluminum, plastic, paper, metal, etc.  She is a very selfless woman who starts work very early every morning and finishes very late at night.  She is very proud of everything that she does as hers is decent and honest work and it allows her to help her family.

Rita is requesting this loan to buy aluminum, plastic, paper, metal, etc. which she will then be able to re-sell and enjoy greater profit margins.  All of the members of this group are very grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, plastic, paper, metal, etc. to re-sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, está casada junto a Edwin con quien tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia además de su padre quien lo acompaña en su lucha constante para mantener la vida tranquila que llevan. El trabajo de María consiste en la venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, entre los que se encuentran arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa que se encuentra ubicada en una esquina de la avenida principal de su distrito, ahí atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando 5 años en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su padre pero ahora el negocio es solo de ella y recibe la ayuda de otra señorita en algunas ocasiones cuando ella tiene que cumplir otras funciones fuera de casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su barrio, espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 9 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo. 
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mercadería para su venta en su bodega conformada por golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites verduras y otros.
texts.en:
46-year-old María is a hard-working, very responsible woman.  She is married to Edwin and the couple have two children who are 11 and 14 years old.  María lives in her own home together with her whole family including her father, who shares her constant struggle to maintain the peaceful life they lead.  

María's business is selling basic household products retail, including rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil and vegetables.  Her business is in her home which is  located on a corner of the main avenue in her district.  She serves in her shop every day, full time, and has been in this business for five years.  At first, she had her father's help but now the business is hers alone and she receives help from another lady on occasions when she needs to go out and do other things.  What María likes about her work is that she has time to carry out other activities.  Fortunately, her business is doing very well.  She always has customers because of the range of products she sells and because hers is the only grocery store in her neighborhood.  She hopes to be able to continue developing and growing her business.

This is María's 9th loan from MFP.  She is grateful to all the people who give her the loans she needs to increase her working capital.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy merchandise to sell in her store.  She will buy candies, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy candies, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 13 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad en la cual se trabajan por más pequeña que esta sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, ya que el grupo les ayudará a mejorar.
Gilda miembro de este grupo, comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas, su trabajo es muy difícil, ya que tiene mucha competencia, y es por eso que ella siempre trata de innovar para salir adelante y tener mejor variedad para atraer a clientela. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de toda variedad para poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
Agradecen todas las miembros por la gran oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 'Kuña Pora' group is from the city of Concepción.  It has 13 members who each have a small business in which they work.  The ladies are very excited as the group will help them to improve.

Gilda is a member of this group.  She says that her business is selling clothing and her work is very difficult as she has a lot of competition.  For this reason, she always tries to innovate in order to continue making progress.  She also tries to have a better range of products in order to attract customers.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying all kinds of clothing so that she can continue offering a good range to her customers.

All the members of this group are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Джахонгиру 19 лет. Он вместе с родителями живет на Севере Таджикистана. Он студент 3 курса таджикского Государственного Университета по специальности юриста. Он является одним из успешных студентов и активно участвует в жизни университета. Джахонгир должен оплатить за учебный договор, но доход его родителей от продажи женской одежды не хватает для этого. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, вместе ему поможем окончить университет и стать будущим юристом.
texts.en: Jahongir is 19 years old and he lives with his parents in northern Tajikistan.  He is a third-year law student at the Tajik State University.  Jahongir is one of the more successful students and he actively participates in student life at the university.  He needs to pay his tuition fees, but the income his parents make from selling women's clothing does not allow for this expense.  He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition.  Jahongir is awaiting your kindness.  Together we can help him finish his studies and become a future lawyer.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Малохат занимается торговлей продуктов питания. На сегодняшний день она открыла собственный магазин. Торговлей Малохат занимается пятнадцать лет. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Malohat lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 44 years old and is married with six children.  Malohat sells food products and now she has opened her own store.  She has been trading for 15 years.  She is asking for a loan to increase her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 35 years old and is married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling general supplies in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as boxes of tinned fish, corned beef, snacks, soft drinks, salt, onions, etc. 

In the future, Anita  hopes to improve her business and to provide a better future for her children. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tinned fish, corned beef, snacks, soft drinks, salt, onions, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Gabunon, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old, is married and has four children. To make a living, Virginia grows crops, particularly corn. She has been in her business for 11 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Virginia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase her crop yield. She joined GDMPC this year. Virginia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммадджону 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Его родители занимаются купле продажей золотых изделия, но их доход не хватает для оплаты учебы их сына, так как Мухаммадджон является студентом 1 курса Экономического Государственного Университета Таджикистана факультет Налоговое дело. Он является одним из успешных студентов и активно участвует в жизни университета. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, вместе ему поможем стать хорошим специалистом будущим.
texts.en: Muhammadjon is 18 years old.  He is married and lives with his parents, who buy and sell gold products.  However, their income is not enough to pay for their son's education, as Muhammadjon is a first-year student at the Tajikistan State Economic University in the tax department.  He is one of the more successful students and he actively participates in student life.  He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition.  Muhammadjon is awaiting your kindness.  Together we can help him become a future tax specialist.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Саодат портниха. Она предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Саодат шьет национальные платья с вышивками. В этой области она четыре года. Саодат берет кредит для приобретения новой модернизированной швейной машинки.
texts.en: Saodat lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 37 years old and is married with three children.  Saodat is a dressmaker; she offers this service in her own home, where she sews national costumes with embroidered embellishments.  She has been in this line of work for four years.  Saodat is asking for a loan to buy a new modern sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new, up-to-date sewing machine.

loans.name: Tutumau

texts.en:
Tutumau is a 54-year-old married woman with four children. She would like to start growing a taro plantation to earn a living. Tutumau has requested a loan to support her taro crops and wishes to buy fertilizers, chemicals, weed spray, a shovel, gloves, etc. 

Tutumau has been a member of SPBD for one year. She will spend her profits on improving and extending her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, weed spray, a shovel, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan previously accessed a loan of 30,000 PHP that she used to buy additional garlic supplies for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child's education and for their personal, household and business expenditure. 

Susan would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan so she can buy additional garlic supplies for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes that her business will grow and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional garlic supplies for her business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita, aged 42, is from BayBay, Bagumbang, Bonifacio. She is married with five children. Jovita sells fish to earn a living. She has been in this business for 17 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Jovita joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more green bananas to sell

loans.name: Floramae

texts.en:
Floramae is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children aged five and three. She has a business selling woven baskets and other handicrafts, as well as canned goods and eggs, to the people in her community.

Floramae needs additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy more baskets and eggs to sell. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success and to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more baskets and eggs to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She operates a business that buys and sells rice, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ma. Fe is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities using the past two loans she has received from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
24 mujeres se unieron para trabajar y de esa unión surge el grupo llamado nueva esperanza, ya que con la esperanza de salir adelante y dejar la pobreza atrás es que se han conformado. Están en su primer ciclo y la meta de cada una es poder llegar hasta el máximo nivel y así no solo crecer en lo económico, sino también en sus respectivos trabajos.
Francisca, la presidenta, se dedica a la venta de asaditos (Churrasco). Le encanta su trabajo, ya que le va muy bien, y sumado a eso le gusta mucho cocinar. Ella es una persona con grandes ganas de seguir creciendo y es por ello que lucha.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carnes, condimentos, mandioca, pan y demás para poder seguir haciendo sus asaditos.
texts.en:
Twenty-four women came together to work and out of this union arose a group called "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] since the hope of moving forward and leaving poverty behind is what has brought them together. They are in their first loan cycle and the goal of each one is to be able to reach the highest level so as to grow not only financially but also in their respective lines of work. 

Francisca, the president, earns a living selling grilled meat preparations known as "churrasco." She loves her work since it is going very well for her, and, on top of that she really likes to cook. She is a person with great drive to continue growing, and that is what she is fighting for. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of meat, condiments, manioc, bread and other items in order to continue making her grilled meat dish.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, manioc, bread and other items.

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie, aged 25, is a single entrepreneur from Tugas, Tangub City. He earns an income from his motorcycle transport business which he started almost two years ago and from which he earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve his business, Louie is borrowing 15,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit which he joined recently.  He will use the loan to buy motorcycle accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories and tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a rural villager from Takeo Province's Samrong District where silk weaving is a popular business in the neighborhood. She is 48 years old and also one of the breadwinners in her family which consists of three schoolchildren (one daughter and two sons). Sokha is a silk weaver and a grocery seller in the local area while her husband is a rice farmer on one hectare of farmland to tackle the family's difficulties. 

Having been engaged in this business for 25 years, Sokha is able to save up to five US dollars per day from her current business after deducting the expenses. This is Sokha's second-cycle loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The previous business loan, which she successfully repaid, helped her to sustain her living conditions as well as gradually helping her business. 

In this loan cycle, she is applying for an education loan of 1,600 US dollars to cover the entire tuition fees for four years for her oldest son, an 18-year-old freshman specializing in finance and banking at a local university. Sokha very much hopes that this loan will enable her to send her oldest son to university. That will also help her son to obtain a higher education background so that he can get a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: To pay university tuition fees for her oldest son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 32-year old, married entrepreneur from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City with 3 children. She has had a transport service business for almost 7 years now and earns 5,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is requesting an amount of 8,000 PHP  from GDMPC, which she joined in 2010, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconut to resell.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame Hawa  est âgée de 43 ans,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle loge chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Diamarabougou de Markala, dans la quatrième région administrative du Mali..
 N’ayant pas été très loin à l’école, elle a appris le petit commerce à l’enfance  à côté de sa maman qui vendait des condiments. Elle effectue le petit commerce de riz depuis plus de 30 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation. Sa force de vente est l’accueil et la vente des céréales de qualité.  
Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour pouvoir assurer le stock de vente, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé 9 cycles de prêt solidaire, elle est à son 1er cycle de prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 12 sacs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne en riz avec les producteurs de l’office du Niger. 
Madame  Hawa vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA, qui serait  utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif de devenir grossiste dans la vente de céréales.
texts.en: Mrs Hawa is 43 years old, married, a mother of 7 children, and lives with her husband and other family members in the Diamarabougou neighborhood in the commune of Markala, the fourth largest administrative region in Mali. Mrs Hawa did not attend much school, but learned the aspects of being involved in a small business as a child, while being next to her mom, who sold condiments. For the last 30 years she has been selling rice and has gained a very positive reputation for being welcoming and for selling cereals of great quality. In order to increase her capital and to insure she has enough merchandise to sell, she is asking for a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly reimbursed 9 other group loans, she is asking for her first individual loan, which she plans to use towards the purchase of 12 bags of rice. She stocks up on rice from the 'Office of Niger'. Mrs Hawa sells for cash and credit to a customer base comprised of both men and women. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA (approximately 84 USD), which she will used to take care of the needs of her home. She hopes to someday become a wholesaler for a variety of cereals and grains.

loans.use: purchase rice

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Agée de 38 ans, Madame Oumou est mariée et mère   de 6  enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier  Diamarabougou de Markala.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des arisons sociales, elle commença le commerce à côté de son père qui vendait des céréales. Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle adhéra au programme de prêts solidaires de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir fait 9 cycles, elle  est à son 1er cycle de prêt individuel qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter  20 sacs de savon kabakourouni et 30 cartons de savon industriel, elle  s’approvisionne au grand marché de Ségou.  
Madame Oumou vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte.  Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 73.500 FCFA, ce dernier lui permet de prendre en charge les petites dépenses familiales du foyer.
texts.en: Mrs Oumou is a 38 year old married woman and mother of 6 children. They all live together in the Diamarabougou neighborhood in the commune of Markala. She did not attend school due to social reasons, but began working in business alongside her father, who sold cereals. She has been continuing to work in the retail sector for the last 20 years and has amassed an important experience. In order to satisfy the demands of her customers, she is a member of the microlending program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having successfully completed 9 cycles of group loans, she is asking for her first individual loan in order to purchase 20 bags of kabakourouni (locally made soap) and 30 boxes of industrial soap. She stocks up on these items at the big market in Ségou. She sells for cash and credit to a mixed customer base. She hopes that the loan will allow her to have a monthly profit of 73,500 FCFA (approximately 141 USD) which will enable her to take cares of the small household expenses.

loans.use: purchase local soap (kabakourouni) and industrial soap

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Sewa sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires avec en moyenne 41 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Hamdallaye dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château Ségou. Elles font l’achat et la vente des pagnes wax, foulards, céréales et condiments (échalote, piments, gombo, etc.…. Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Fatoumata (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 kg d’échalote. Elle se ravitaille en condiments avec les forains de Niono et des villages environnants de Ségou; La revente se fait en détails au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou. Avec ce prêt, madame  Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The six women comprising the Sewa group are married, have an average age of 41 years with 6 children, and mostly live in nuclear families. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood in the city of Ségou, and met due to their similar retail activities at the Château Ségou market. They are all involved in the purchase and sale of wax, scarves, cereals and condiments (shallots, peppers, okra, etc). In order to increase their activity they reached out to Soro Yiriwaso, and are asking for their second group loan.
Fatoumata (seen standing on the far left in the photo) is involved in the sale of all types of condiments. She hopes to use her loan to purchase 200 kilos of shallots. She stocks up on products from the stallkeepers at Niono and the villages near Ségou, and re-sells them both in wholesale and in smaller quantities by cash and credit to a customer based largely comprised of women. She sells these products in an ambulatory way directly at people's homes or at the Château Ségou market. Fatoumata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA (approximately 58 USD) with this loan, which she will use to reinvest in her retail activity and to take charge of the little needs of her home.

loans.use: purchase shallots

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en:
Residing in the Samrong District of Takeo Province, Sophany is 42 years old and married. She has five sons, four of whom still depend on her and who are still in school. The other one is a first-year university student. Sophany has struggled to make a living through silk weaving for her five children’s sake especially for their education while her husband supplements their income via two hectares of rice cultivation. Sophany has been engaged in her business for 21 years and is able to earn up to US$14 per day. However, she is able to save only US$3 per day after deducting all related expenses. 

Sophany has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund for a US$1,200 loan to pay for her son's university fees for the remaining three years. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue his degree so he can find a good job after graduation. This will also help to relieve her financial burden and worry about the future in terms of supporting her children’s education. Hence, she can use the earned income from the current business to sustain and grow her business and also can pay more attention to generating more income for her family especially to support her other children.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university fees

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. He earns an income through providing transportation services. He has done this for 5 years to support the needs of his 2 children. He gets an income of 5,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 42-year old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier then when he sees his children succeed in their studies. Without hesitation, Edwin requests to borrow an amount of 9,500 PHP from GDMPC to repair his transport vehicle and provide his children a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
This is Marieta, a 59-year-old mother from Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Pablo, a vendor.  She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
Marieta operates a retail stall. It is a smaller version of a variety store where she sells a few products like cigarettes and candy. She also sells newspapers in the morning. She is also a banana dealer and she buys large amounts to sell to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50, 000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like cigarettes, candies, charcoal and bananas. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Marieta dreams that her children will have a better future and hopes that her business will grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products like charcoal, cigarettes, candies and bananas needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is from Panay, Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old. Miguel is married and has two children. To make a living, Miguel owns & operates a transportation service and from this he earns 6,000 PHP per month. He has been doing this work for 4 years. Miguel joined GDMPC in 2007. Miguel is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts. Miguel plans to improve the general living conditions of his family and his business as well.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Jonjie

texts.en:
This is Jonjie, 27, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Richard, the father to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jonjie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jonjie hopes her children will finish their studies and dreams of expanding her business through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
A widowed mother of two children who lives in the Samrong District of Takeo Province, Nen does rice planting and silk weaving to support her entire family as a single mother. With 35 years' experience in these businesses, she is able to earn up to 6 USD per day and to keep 1.5 USD each day as savings. The main expenses for her family are daily food consumption and her children’s schooling. 

Nen has joined VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is now applying for 1,222 USD to pay for her son’s university tuition. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also that it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s university tuition

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is a citizen from a rural area located in Takeo Province’s Samrong District where crop farming and silk weaving are common businesses to make a living. She is married and is the 35-year-old mother of two children. One of her children is at school while the other one is too young for schooling. To feed her household, she earns a living through silk weaving while her husband does rice cropping. She is able to earn up to US$12 per day from this business in which she has been working for 17 years and she can manage to save only US$3 each day for future needs. 

Chanthou, who has never been with VisionFund before, is seeking her first loan of US$1,600. She is going to use this loan for her children's education, by paying the tuition fees for the four years of her son’s bachelor degree majoring in finance and banking. This loan will enable her to send her son to university and to keep him there. Chanthou hopes that her children will have a good and bright future from these academic studies and earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: To pay her son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 58 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, es viuda, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno de 25 años de edad vive a su lado en su casa propia, todos los días trabaja mucho para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de María actualmente consiste en el alquiler de minidepartamentos y a precios cómodos. Para la construcción de estas viviendas contó con el apoyo de su esposo cuando estaba vivo. Lleva en esta actividad más de 20 años. Ahora se encuentra en pleno acondicionamiento de algunas de las habitaciones, tiene clientes que le pagan puntualmente, algunos de ellos ya viven permanentemente. Se siente feliz desarrollando su actividad porque se pueden recibir ingresos diarios y buenas ganancias mensuales sin realizar esfuerzo alguno, además se siente muy tranquila porque puede colaborar con el sustento de su hogar, espera que le siga yendo bien para que pueda seguir trabajando con tranquilidad. Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mallas para cubrir las ventanas. Asimismo, comprará algunos accesorios para el baño y acondicionar más habitaciones.
texts.en:
María is fifty-eight years old and is a hard-working and fighting woman.  She is a widow, and has three children, one of which is twenty-five years old and lives by her side in her own home.  Every day she works a lot in order to improve her quality of life.

Maria's current work consists of renting small apartments at affordable prices.  For the construction of these housing units, she counted on the support of her husband when he was alive.  She has been involved in this work for more than twenty years.  Now she is putting air-conditioning in some rooms.  She has customers that pay her on-time, and some of her tenants now live there permanently.  She feels happy developing her work because she can receive daily income and good monthly profits without making much effort.  She also feels calm because she can contribute to the livelihood of her home.  She hopes that things will continue going well for her and that she will be able to continue working in peace.

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She is thankful to all who have made it possible for her to have access to this type of financing.  With this help, she is sure she will advance in her work.  She promises to pay all her installments on time.  She feels calm and supported by the members of her communal bank.

With the amount she is requesting (2500), she will buy mesh to cover the windows.  She will also buy some items for the bathrooms and will put air-conditioning into more rooms.

loans.use: to buy mesh window coverings and bathroom items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, rice, and noodles for her store.

loans.name: Margielita

texts.en:
Margielita is a very hard working entrepreneur.   She is 55 years old and is married with 12 children, one of whom goes to school.

Margielita has a fish vending business in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF, to buy additional fish to sell.
Margielita has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza of Yahong, Tudela, helps her family through their charcoal making and production business.  She is 29 years old, married with 2 children, and tries her best to earn her own living. She has managed this business for 3 years and earns about 4,500 per month.  

Currently, she needs coconut shells for charcoal making.  She joined GDMPC Microfinance in 2011 and is grateful for the previous loan of 10,500 they provided to her.  Riza desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family.   She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.  Maria has been in this business for 5 years.
In the future, Maria would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 26 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF. She will purchase additional stock to sell, like spices, snack foods, eggs, etc.. Marilou has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like spices, snack foods, eggs etc. for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 61 years old and married with one child. Marina works hard to provide for her family. Her business is to buy and sell Nipa, woven palm mats used for the construction of house and repair in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of Nipa to sell.

Marina has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF, before this one. She has been doing this Nipa trading business for 10 years, and also earns an income from fish vending. Marina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of Nipa to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Marlyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF, to buy more stock like can goods, egg, noodles, soap, etc. to sell at her general store.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities in the past through 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock like can goods, egg, noodles, soap, etc. for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for equipment maintenance

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
Entering their fourth loan, most of the members of Marga Damai group have businesses involving sows and local pigs, most of which are sold every two months. As the group's leader, Ni Ketut is a good example of its members. With two sows that will give birth soon, Ni Ketut plans to use her portion of the loan to purchase super quality feeds for her pigs. She will later sell the piglets for fattening.

Ni Ketut is really happy about and thankful to Kiva, MUK and lenders for supporting both her business and the group. Now she can support her husband’s income to fulfill their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feeds.

loans.name: Fatu W.

texts.en: Fatu is 48 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and she has five  children between the ages of 27 and 32. All  of them are attending school and living  on their own. For the past three years, she has been selling rice and oil in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. She plans to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace, aged 33, is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a laborer at a construction site, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mary Grace operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two people when buying cooked rice and food costs less than raw food. Mary Grace also has a direct selling business to earn additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help continue operating her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. Mary Grace will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Mary Grace hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of providing her children with a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings needed in her business.

loans.name: Capistrano

texts.en:
Capistrano previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase spare parts for appliances needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for his children's education and for his family's personal, household and business expenditure. 

He would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy spare parts for appliances that he will use in his repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Capistrano hopes to have another shop in the coming years and dreams of being able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work in his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies there. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts for appliances needed in his business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, aged 40, is married with five children, four of whom attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past six years. 

Cristina has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock and ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock and ingredients

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 29 years old and is married with three children. She is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. Elisa provides transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been engaged in this work for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

In 2011, Elisa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP which will be used to repair the motorcycle used in her business. Elisa wants to financially support the members of her immediate family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle used in her transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the pump boat that he uses for fishing

loans.name: Mireli

texts.es:
Mireli, de 44 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, convive con Homero con quien tiene 6 hijos sin embargo vive solo con una de ellas quien tiene 13 años de edad, los tres viven en su casa propia y a diario se esfuerzan al máximo para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y progresar. El trabajo de Mireli comienza muy temprano con la apertura de su bodega. Tiene un establecimiento que ha construido en su casa y ahí ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles como arroz, panes, sal, azúcar, verduras, té, leche, huevos y otros. Vive en una zona muy concurrida lo cual le permite tener buenas ventas durante el día. También tiene otro puesto de ventas en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad que lo compró a la asociación de vendedores tras muchos años de ahorro constante, ahí realiza el mismo trabajo tratando muy bien a sus clientes. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 3 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su cónyuge. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que esta ligado a las ventas y ella siempre se consideró una buena comerciante, además gracias a la cantidad de clientes que ha conseguido en estos años obtiene muchas ventas y por lo tanto tiene muy buenas ganancias, espera poder agrandar su espacio de atención y ofrecer a la venta mas productos. Este es el crédito numero 9 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas mercadería como verduras, 2 sacos de arroz, aceite en litros y azúcar.
texts.en:
Mireli, age 44, is a very dynamic and hard-working woman.  She lives with Homero, and they have six children.  However, she only lives with one of them, the 13 year old.  The three of them live in their own house.  Every day they put forth maximum effort in order to be able to improve their quality of life and get ahead.

Mireli’s work starts very early when she opens her grocery store.  She has an establishment that she has built at her house.  That is where she sells all types of food products like rice, bread, salt, sugar, vegetables, tea, milk, eggs, and more.  She lives in a very busy area, which allows her to have good sales during the day.  She also has another sales stand at one of the main markets in the city.  She used her constant savings to buy it from an association of sellers many years ago.  She does the same work there, and she treats her customers very well.  She has been doing this work for three years, and her husband helps her.

What she likes about her work is that it has to do with selling.  She has always considered herself to be a good merchant.  Also, thanks to the number of customers she has gotten during these years, she gets a lot of sales.  Therefore, she has very good income.

She hopes to enlarge the area where she takes care of her customers, and she wants to offer them more products.  This is her ninth loan with MFP.  She is very grateful to the people who give her this loan that she needs in order to realize her plans.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She hopes to continue working with her communal bank because of their camaraderie and the solidarity shown between each one of the members.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy more merchandise like two sacks of rice, liters of cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, liters of cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
Mera works hard to support her family. She is married and has a Nipa trading business in the Philippines. Nipa is a woven palm mat used for house construction and repair in the Philippines.

Mera has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of Nipa to sell. Mera has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mera would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma.   She buys cell phone accessories and merchandise from wholesalers and sells them retail.  She previously received a 10,000 PHP loan, that she used to buy phone accessories and other products for sale.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy phone accessories like housing, battery, charger, sim card, head set and other products needed in her business.  Her profits will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gratitude.

Through all her hard work in her business, Wilma dreams of being able to give both her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.   She also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cell phone accessory items for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 44 years old and married with six children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.  

Merlyn is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF, to purchase additional livestock.  Merlyn has been raising livestock for 25 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell, like soft drinks, bread, eggs,and canned goods.

Mila has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Mila would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell, like soft drinks, bread, eggs,and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more herbal soap and food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru: Надежда торгует на рынке Камаевский женской одеждой и обувью. Надежда - пунктуальная, вежливая и трудолюбивая. Она всегда находится на своем рабочем месте, всегда следит за обновлением товара, у нее хороший выбор товара и хорошее качество. Кредит понадобился для закупки зимней одежды и обуви: зимних женских сапог, женских свитеров, пиджаков, а так же теплых юбок.
texts.en: Nadezhda sells women's clothing and shoes at the Kamaevsky market. She is punctual, polite, and hard-working. Nadezhda spends her whole days at her workplace, always keeps her inventory up-to-date, and offers a good assortment of quality merchandise. She needs this loan to purchase winter clothing and footwear: women's winter boots, sweaters, jackets and warm skirts.

loans.use: to stock up on winter clothing and shoes

loans.name: Violy

texts.es: Violy con su crédito anterior compró una vitrina mostrador y mercancia con la que la surtió, su negocio se ve muy elegante y la clientela se impacta cada vez que pasa por él. En la actualiad está plicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará mucha mercancia navideña y de fin de año, para recibir a su clientela muy moderna y ajustada a la época con articulos como ropa interior y exterior, fantasias,y perfumería. productos por  los cuales está esperando su clientela.Su mensaje  a los financiadoress de Kiva es de mucho agradecimiento, porque gracias a Kiva ha podido beneficiarse y aumentar sus utilidades, tal como otras microempresarias.
texts.en:
Violy used her previous loan to buy a display case and merchandise to stock her business.  It looks elegant, and customers are impacted every time they pass by it.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy a lot of merchandise for Christmas and the end of the year.  She wants to receive her customers with up to date items and seasonal products like underwear, clothes, costume jewelry, and perfume.  These are products that her customers are waiting for.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is a very grateful one because, thanks to Kiva, she have been able to benefit and increase her profits, just like other microentrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy things like underwear, clothes, costume jewelry, and perfume.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou,  Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, du lait et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur dix neuvième prêt solidaire. 
BINTOU, première personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter des tissus bazin pour la teinture avec les revendeurs de Bamako pour ensuite teinter les tissus qui seront vendus sur place à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de teinture.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women and widows. The mean age of the group members is 38 years old, and each woman has, on average, three children. The women live in large traditional families in the town of Konobougou, in the Ségou Region (fourth-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

The group members met one another through family, neighbors, and friends. They sell clothing and milk, and they prepare food.

The Benkadi group is on its nineteenth group loan.

BINTOU (the person farthest to the right in the photo) plans to buy damask fabric for dyeing from retailers in Bamako. She will then dye the fabrics and sell them from home and at the market to a clientele of both men and women.

She sees herself earning an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, part of which she will use to buy necessities for her family. She will reinvest the rest of her profits in her dyeing business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and dyes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase health and beauty aids, fashion accessories, video games and clothing inventory in preparation for the upcoming holidays to help his company grow.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is a 23-year-old married man from Antequera, Bohol. He has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business for several years now. He transports passengers going from one place to another. He is also engaged in selling firewood to the market.

Anecito is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle such as nuts, bolts, lubricating oil, etc. With the loan, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle such as nuts, bolts, lubricating oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Laura Magdalena

texts.es:
LAURA MAGDALENA tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

LAURA MAGDALENA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea,insecticidas, abonos, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar la producción.
   
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 8 días. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero. 
El sueño es tener más sembríos. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Laura Magdalena is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. She lives with her common-law husband and children in the city of Ventanas within the province of Los Rios.

She is a member of the communal bank AVANZA. The members work in agriculture and live in the sector of Agua Frías, where they grew up. They mostly work in agriculture or with livestock.

Laura Magdalena works in agriculture planting corn and rice as well as breeding pigs. She will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs, such as urea, insecticides, fertilizer, and Ranger herbicide. With this loan, she will be able to increase her production.

She will buy the supplies in the city of Ventanas every 8 days. The challenge she faces is the lack of money.

She hopes to have more sown fields. In her spare time, she likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, such as urea, insecticides, fertilizer, and Ranger herbicide.

loans.name: Don

texts.en:
Don established Horizon Advisors as a financial services corporation in 2011. Don contracts with financial planning specialists to provide written financial action plans, asset allocation plans, financial safety plans, tax action plans and estate action plans to his clients. 

Don is responsible for signing new clients and coordinating meetings with their advisors. Currently. he has 22 clients but his goal is to reach 85 clients.  

He is seeking a loan of $7,500 to hire a contract employee to assist him with scheduling, office duties and meeting preparations.

loans.use: to hire a contract employee to assist him with scheduling, office duties and meeting preparations.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, convive hace muchos años con su pareja llamado Carlos y aún no tienen hijos, ambos viven juntos en sus casa propia desde donde hacen todo lo posible para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Rosario consiste en la compra y venta de celulares. Tiene un establecimiento de ventas ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Ofrece a la venta los últimos modelos de celulares de la mejor tecnología, en diferentes precios y para todos los gustos. Su principal proveedor de celulares es una de las empresas de telefonía lideres en el país que le brindan todo el material de propaganda de los artículos que ofrece y eso le permite tener la mejor garantía de los productos y gracias a ello puede consolidar más y mejores clientes. Trabaja con ayuda de 2 personas más y realiza esta labor por más de 8 años. Afortunadamente le va muy bien y eso le da mucha tranquilidad. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre tiene clientes que necesitan de algún celular o algún accesorio, espera que su negocio siga creciendo para convertirse en una empresa distribuidora de celulares y expandir sus puntos de venta. 
Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona responsable, está feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder realizar una buena inversión, además está segura de que cancelará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo hasta ahora, esta muy comprometida con el grupo al que pertenece y no desea dejar una mala impresión ni a ellos ni a la institución.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará cierta cantidad de celulares y accesorios de telefonía como audífonos, estuches, chip y otros.
texts.en:
Rosario, 30 years old, is an enterprising and responsible woman.  She has lived for many years together with her partner Carlos and even though they have no children, they live together in their own house where they do everything possible to improve their quality of life.

Rosario’s work consists of the buying and selling of cell phones.  She has a sales establishment located in a central area of the city.  She offers the latest cell phone models of the best technology for sale, at different prices and to suit all tastes.  Her principal provider of cell phones is one of the leading phone companies in the country that provides her with all of the advertising material for the articles that she offers.  This allows her to have the best guarantee of the products and thanks to that she can consolidate more and better clients.  She works with the help of two other people and she has worked at this job for more than 8 years.  Fortunately it is going very well for her and this gives her great peace of mind.

What she likes about her job is that she always has customers who need a cell phone or some accessory.  She hopes that her business continues to grow to become a distributing business of cell phones and to expand its points of sales.

This is her second loan with the institution MFP.  She is always characterized within her group as a responsible person.  She is happy for the opportunity that they offer her to be able to make a good investment.  She is also sure that she will be able to pay her installments on time as she has done until now.  She is very committed to the group to which she belongs and she doesn’t want to leave a bad impression on them or on the institution.  

With the amount requested of 2,000 soles (PEN), she will buy a certain quantity of cell phones and telephone accessories such as headphones, cases, memory cards and other things.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories like headphones, cases, memory cards and other things.

loans.name: Coster

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Coster. He describes himself as a happy family man. He is married and has four children. Coster runs grocery and mobile money transfer shops.
 
Coster started running his mobile money transfers shop in the year 2009. From the time he started, he has managed to open two more outlets in two different towns called Nakonde and Mumbwa. He describes his business as a platform that allows people in Zambia to send and receive money safely.

Coster has a vision to open more mobile money transfer shops throughout the country.

He is taking out a Kiva loan so that he can increase his working capital at his Kaoma shop. This will help Coster to serve more customers and make more profits. The profits will help him pay for his children’s school fees.

In the video, a representative from Zoona talks to Coster.

loans.use: To serve more customers who want to send and receive money from his shop.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie. She previously accessed a 21,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different accessories and personal products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in paying for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Rosalie would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy different accessories and personal products such as sunglasses, mirrors, combs, ponytail holders and other products. She will also buy different toys as she is expanding her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalie hopes her children will finish their studies and dreams of expanding her business through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different accessories and personal products such as sunglasses, mirrors, combs, ponytail holders and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in a basket weaving business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Basket weaving is a common way of living in her place. They use bamboo, "buri" or native palm to make baskets.

Celsa is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving such as buri, wicker and straw. With this, she will be able to increase the number of her finished products.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving such as buri, wicker and straw.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Henry. He is a Zoona mobile money transfer business owner. His business deals in the receiving and sending of money. This is Henry's story:

My name is Henry. I run a mobile money transfer shop at the Kazungula border post here in Zambia. I recently got married and I am looking forward to have a big family.

I am grateful for the opportunity to be on Kiva, because getting a loan in Zambia is very hard due to high interest rates. When I get this loan, I will put it in my business so that I can have more people come to my shop to send and receive their monies. 

My vision is to keep growing the business by always increasing my working capital. I want to reach a point were I never have to turn away a customer because I have run out of cash. I look forward to taking out another Kiva loan as soon as I have repaid this one.

loans.use: To increase his mobile money transfer working capital so that he can serve more customers at the border.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka, de 44 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres únicamente con su hermano, quien es su principal compañía y su mejor motivo para seguir adelante. 
El trabajo de Milka consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi. Tiene 3 vehículos que pudo obtener gracias a créditos anteriores que le brindó la institución complementado con algunos ahorros que acumuló por cierto tiempo. Tiene choferes experimentados que diariamente acuden muy temprano a su casa para recibir el vehículo respectivo en el que trabajan por las calles de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad más de 10 años y le va muy bien por que tiene un ingreso fijo diario que le ayudan a sobrellevar los gastos básicos de su hogar. Trabaja en la supervisión de los mototaxis con ayuda de su hermano quien es mecánico y le brinda toda la asesoría técnica necesaria. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede organizar su tiempo y disponer de sus ratos libres como ella lo considere, afirma que de esta forma se siente una mujer capaz e independiente. Espera continuar trabajando y desarrollando sus funciones a cabalidad. Su gran deseo es establecer un negocio formal y de mayor productividad en su propia casa orientada al sector alimenticio. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará repuestos y accesorios para mejorar las condiciones de su flota de mototaxis.
texts.en:
Milka, 44, is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She's single and has no children.  She lives in her parents' house with only her brother, who is her main company and her best motivation for moving forward.

Milka's job is renting motorcycle taxis.  She has three vehicles that she managed to get thanks to previous loans from the institution, supplementing with some savings she had been accumulating for some time.  She has experienced drivers who arrive at her house very early to get the vehicles they drive through the streets of the city.

She has been in this business for more than 10 years and it's going very well for her because she has a fixed daily income that helps her cover the basic household expenses.  She works supervising the taxis with the help of her brother, a mechanic who provides all the necessary mechanical assistance.

What she likes about her job is that she can organize her time and spend her free time as she likes.  She says this way she's a capable and independent woman.  She hopes to continue working and carrying out her duties to the best of her ability.  Her big desire is to set up a formal and more productive business in the food sector in her own house.

This is her second loan with MFP.  This is why she's grateful to those who make the loan possible, which will help her fulfill her objectives.  She also comments that she's comfortable with her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles [PEN] she'll buy spare parts and accessories to improve her fleet of motorcycle taxis.

loans.use: to buy parts and accessories for her fleet of motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 40 years old and married with nine children.

Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as soft drinks, biscuits, eggs, spices, etc.

Perlita has borrowed and paid off three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Perlita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as soft drinks, biscuits, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
JOSE LUIS tiene 28 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría.

JOSE LUIS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar la producción. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. El sueño es comprarse una finca y tener ma´s siembras. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
JOSE LUIS, 28, is a single man with two children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, a city in Los Rios province.  

He is a member of the AVANZA community bank.  Its members are farmers, all of whom live in the area around Agua Frias.  Most of them grew up in the area and make their livings from farming businesses.  

JOSE LUIS grows maize for a living.  He also raises pigs and chickens.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, pesticides, urea, weed killer, etc.  

The investment will allow him to increase his yield.  He buys and sells what he needs in Ventanas.  He has to overcome bad weather and crop diseases.  For the future, he wants to buy a farm of his own and plant more crops.  In his spare time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, de 49 años, es una mujer valiente y trabajadora, está casada con Max y con él tiene 6 hijos. Trabajan mucho para poder sacar adelante su familia y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Maritza consiste en la venta de bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, tiene 2 refrigeradoras en su casa en donde congela a diario todas las bebidas que luego pone a la venta a sus ocasionales clientes. Afortunadamente le va muy bien y sus ventas mejoran con el paso del tiempo. Además vende hielos. Lleva en este negocio más de 8 años y lo hace con ayuda de sus hijos mientras su esposo desarrolla otras actividades. Además de vender gaseosas, también vende hielos y chupetes que son del agrado de sus clientes y que también le generan un ingreso económico adicional para su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede trabajar a lado de sus hijos y disponer del tiempo necesario para hacer otras actividades, su negocio le brinda muy buenas ganancias ya que es muy conocida en su sector por la actividad que realiza, espera mantener el mismo ritmo de trabajo y más adelante desea ampliar con mayor cantidad de productos que son solicitados por los clientes en la zona en la que vive y convertirse en un centro de distribución. Este es el crédito número 11 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además está muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo del que forma parte ya que todos sus integrantes son muy puntuales y responsables. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará más bebidas para tener en stock  y así poder cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maritza, 49, is a courageous and hardworking woman.  She's married to Max and has six children with him.  They work a lot to be able to get the family ahead and give them a better quality of life.

Maritza's job is selling beverages such as soda and beer.  She has two refrigerators in her house where every day she freezes all the drinks that she later sells to her occasional customers.  Fortunately it's going very well for her and her sales improve all the time.  She also sells ice and lollipops, which pleases her customers and also generates additional income for her household.
