Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Maria, integrante del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón y chaqueta de color café, en sus piernas tiene su cartera de color negro, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de comida, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, ofreciendo todo tipo de comidas, además de la preparación de empanadas, trabaja de lunes a lunes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, también realiza la venta de perfumes y mercadería en general en su negocio que está habilitado en una parte de su casa.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para la venta de comida los compra en varias partes como supermercados, carnicerías, molinos (harina a muy buen precio) bodegas, y la ropa, perfumes y accesorios en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará carne, cebollas,aceite y algunos adornos navideños, juguetes, ropa interior.
Una de las metas de Maria es seguir con el negocio, crecer aun más, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su esposo. Sus sueños a nivel personal y familiar tener unas lindas y largas vacaciones junto a su esposo para relajarse y disfrutar de un nuevo paisaje.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called ‘Cascada de Esperanza’ [Waterfall of Hope].  It is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who are in different lines of work.  Among those you will find selling perfume, selling clothes, selling wallets, selling fast food, organizing events, selling bread, selling home accessories, and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Valparaíso.

Maria is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she is seated in the first row, and she is the first person on the right.  She is wearing pants and a brown jacket, and her black purse is on her lap.  Her hair is light brown, and she wears it short.

She has been selling food for three years.  She says that she works at her house, and she sells all types of food.  In addition to making empanadas, she works Mondays through Mondays.  Her schedule is made according to her availability.  She also sells perfume and general merchandise in her business, which is set up in part of her house.

She buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs for her food sales at various places like supermarkets, butcher’s shops, mills (flour at a very good price), and grocery stores.  She buys the clothes, perfume, and accessories for a low cost in the city of Santiago, which is financially desirable.  

She will use the loan to buy meat, onions, cooking oil, and some Christmas decorations, toys, and underwear.  One of Maria’s goals is to continue with the business and to grow even more.  This way she can opt for a better quality of life.

Maria lives with her husband.  Her dream on a personal and familial level is to have a beautiful and large vacation with her husband in order to relax and enjoy new scenery.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  Regarding the communal bank she belongs to, she says that there is very good communication.  The trainings have taught her new strategies for selling and book-keeping.

Valparaiso is located 120 kilometers Northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also host of the country's legislature. It is the nation's first port and offers a variety of landmarks both beautiful and picturesque. For example, the house of Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize, is located here.

loans.use: to buy meat, onions, cooking oil, and some Christmas decorations, toys, and underwear.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 66 years old and married; she has five children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. Conchita has been in this business for 32 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Conchita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Nurul Hikmah 3 Group

texts.en:
Siti, 43 years old, has been blessed with four children: Siska already works, Fauziah and Inas are in Senior and Junior High School, and Inus is still a toddler. Mohammad, her husband, works as a driver of public transportation. He is paid only 100,000 IDR every day. Therefore Siti sells cooked food  for breakfast every day, from  5 am – 7 am in front of her house, to help her husband and fulfill her children's educational needs. Siti has loyal customers, and every day she earns a profit of 75,000 IDR. 

Siti will use her part of this loan to expand her business, by beginning to sell instant cold drinks and mobile phone minutes cards. Too little capital and the competition are her obstacles in running this business.

loans.use: to buy instant drink powder and mobile phone minutes cards.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: Doña Benigna tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Manuel Cortes junto a su hija mayor. Ella tiene muchos años de experiencia en confección de ropa de vestir. Tiene su propio taller establecido en su casa. Confecciona vestidos, faldas, blusas, trajes, pantalones, y otros trabajos de costura. Ya tiene su buena clientela en la colonia donde vive. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar una máquina de coser y telas para la confección de ropa. Con esta inversión ella quiere estar preparada para atender a sus clientes en la época navideña. Su plan es lograr que su negocio prospere y crezca día a día para mejorar la economía del hogar y ser un soporte para su familia. Agradece el apoyo brindado con este financiamiento.
texts.en: Benigna, 56, is a single mother; she has four children and lives in San Manuel Cortes with her oldest daughter.  She has many years’ experience working as a dressmaker.  She has her own workshop set up at home.  She makes dresses, skirts, blouses, suits, pants and other items.  She has a well-established local clientele in her neighborhood.  She’s decided to request a 6,000 Lempira loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make clothes.  She wants to use this investment to be ready for customers during the Christmas season.  Her plan is to succeed in making progress with her business so that it will grow day to day to improve her home’s economy and be a source of family support.  She is grateful for the support provided by this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
La señora Teodolinda tiene 53, es soltera, tiene tres hijos, reside en compañía de 3 nietos una comunidad del municipio de Morazán, Departamento de Yoro.
Teodolinda desde hace 7 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado de manera estacionaria. Además para generar otros ingresos mantiene una cría de cerdos.
Ella se vio motivada a  establecer su negocio con el fin de apoyar a sus nietos con la crianza y educación.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de ropa y calzado para damas, caballeros y niños(as).
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara a aumentar su inventario y disponer de variedad de mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en la temporada navideña.
texts.en: Teodolina, 53, is single and has three children.  She lives with three grandchildren in a community in Morazán, Yoro Department.  For the last seven years she’s been selling clothes and shoes in a stationary way.  In order to generate extra income she also raises pigs.  She was motivated to start her business in order to support her grandchildren helping to raise and school them.  She’s asking for a 12,000 Lempira loan to buy clothes and shoes for women, men and children.  She feels that the loan will help her increase her inventory and have a good selection of merchandise to satisfy customer demand for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María, quiere un nuevo préstamo para poder mejorar el negocio, comprándose los productos necesarios para que su negocio este bien, por ejemplo aceite, elotes, leña y gas, estos son algunos de los cuales son necesarios para preparar la venta de tamales.
Comenta que el préstamo que se le financio anteriormente, le permitió tener lo más necesario para elaborar los tamales, sus condiciones, su nivel de vida han sido mejor, han tenido más oportunidad de obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan to improve her business, buying the products that she needs for her business to be in good shape.  For example, she will buy oil, sweet corn, wood, and propane, which are some of the items necessary to make her tamales (a traditional dish made of cornmeal, sauce, and meat wrapped in palm leaves) for sale.

She notes that the loan she received the last time allowed her to have the most needed items to make her tamales, and her living conditions and level of comfort have improved, and she has a better opportunity to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn on the cob, wood, and propane.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque quiere surtir el negocio de frutas y verduras frescas, ya que se avecina una temporada de mas demanda, para esto deberá estar preparada económicamente, con papas, repollo, tomates, plátanos, zanahorias, cebollas, por ejemplo.
Su efecto reflejado en el negocio ha sido la mejoría en la inversión para tener surtido el negocio, su familia se ha mantenido económicamente estable, ella ha dejado de vender atol por unos meses, solo queda con las verduras y frutas que son más rentables.
texts.en:
Carolina is asking for a new loan because she wants to stock her market stall with fresh fruits and vegetables.  It is getting to be the time of year when there is greater demand, and for this reason, she should be economically prepared with a stock of potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, plantains, carrots, and onions, as some examples.

The effect that has been reflected in her business has been an improvement via her investment, so that she now has a fully stocked shop.  Her family has been able to maintain its financial stability.  She has been able to stop selling atol (a traditional corn gruel) over the past few months, and she now only sells the most profitable fruits and vegetables in her stall.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, plantains, carrots, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is a fish vendor from Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 20 years. This is the source of her income. 

Primitiva is asking for a loan to buy additional fish to sell to the people in her community.

Primitiva hopes to imrpove her business in the future, and she saves money for reinvestment in the same venture and for her future use.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Yilmer Andres

texts.es:
Yilmer es un joven emprendedor de tan solo 18 años de edad y debido a que lleva trabajando durante muchos años al lado de su padre en la actividad de la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, espera poder iniciar su propio negocio y así generarse sus propios ingresos, de modo que un futuro pueda brindarles a sus padres y hermanos una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Gracias al tiempo que ha trabajado con su padre ha podido adquirir la experiencia, y aprovechando esto aspira a que en su negocio pueda crecer rápidamente. La mayor dificultad que tiene es el poco capital con el que cuenta para iniciar el negocio, es por esto que Yilmer busca un préstamo para comprar el surtido inicial de frutas y verduras y así iniciar con su propio negocio de compra y venta de frutas y verduras.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran negocio donde pueda tener buenas ventas y así los ingresos que reciba le permitan brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Yilmer is a young enterpriser, merely 18 years old, and because he has spent many years working along side of his father in the business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables he hopes to be able to begin his own business and thus generate his own income in a way that in the future he can offer his parents and siblings a better quality of life at home.  Thanks to the time that he has worked with his father, he has been able to aqcuire experience and has taken advantage of this, hoping that his business will grow quickly.  The greatest difficulty that he has is the small amount of money that he has to begin the business; this is why Yilmer asks for a loan to buy the initial assortment of fruit and vegetables and thus start his own business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

His dream is to come to have a great business where he can have good sales so that the income he receives allows him to offer his family a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy an initial assortment of fruits and vegetables and thus start his own business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 8 hijos y vive en el sector de Cofradia, Cortes. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas, pero hace más de un años decidió mejor establecer una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, harina, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, refrescos, y otros productos de abarrotería. Doña maría ha sido cliente de ODEF por diez ciclos de préstamos, el que solicita actualmente es de 6,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir el negocio de mas productos como lácteos, granos básicos, manteca, café, pan, azúcar, jabón y refrescos. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener surtido y atender mejor a su clientela. su meta es seguir trabajando para tener un nivel económico y apoyar a sus hijos con la educación y en un futuro ampliar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
María, 45, is married and has 8 children; she lives in the Cofradía sector, Cortes.  She used to sell tortillas but over a year ago decided to open a grocery store where she sells basic staples like rice, beans, lard, eggs, flour, dairy products, canned goods, meats, soft-drinks and other grocery items.  

María has been an ODEF client for ten loan cycles and the one she’s asking for now is for 6,000 Lempiras that she will use to stock the store with more products like dairy products, basic grains, lard, coffee, bread, sugar, soap and soft-drinks.  This investment will help her keep the store well-stocked in order to provide better customer service.  Her goal is to continue working to have a better standard of living and to help with her children’s schooling and in the future expand the business more.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: José Nilson

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 3 hijos, reside en compañía  de su familia en  una comunidad rural del municipio de Victoria, Departamento de Yoro.
José  tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, particularmente a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y fríjoles).
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar  sus cultivos de maíz y fríjoles.
Con el apoyo financiero él espera mejorar su producción.
Su meta es que sus hijos estudien y lograr un buen record crediticio con ODEF.
texts.en: José, 41, lives in free union with his wife; he has three children.  He lives with his family in a rural community in Victoria, Yoro Department.  He’s been working in agriculture for more than 20 years, especially growing basic grains (corn and beans).  He’s currently asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan he plans to use to buy fertilizer to fertilize his corn and bean crops.  He hopes to improve production with the loan.  His goal is that his children study and for him to establish a good credit history with ODEF.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Mirian Selina

texts.es:
La Señora  Mirian tiene 55 años de edad,  está casada, tiene 5 hijos, reside en compañía  de su familia en  una comunidad rural del Municipio de San Francisco, Departamento de Atlántida.
Mirian tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos alimenticios a través de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación.
Decidió establecer su negocio con la motivación de contribuir con los gastos familiares.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de alimentos como: maíz, fríjoles, arroz, azúcar, carnes, lácteos, productos de limpieza, medicamentos de uso común, golosinas y refrescos.
Con el apoyo financiero ella espera aumentar la variedad de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mirian, 55, is married and has five children.  She lives with her family in a rural community in the municipality of San Francisco, Atlántida Department.  Mirian has been selling food items in her grocery store located at home for the last four years.  She decided to start the business motivated by the wish to contribute towards family expenses.  She’s currently asking for a 6,000 Lempira loan to buy food items like corn, beans, rice, sugar, meats, dairy products, cleaning supplies, common use medicines, snacks and soft-drinks.  She hopes with help from the loan to increase the variety of products she has to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Blue Mary

texts.en:
Blue Mary is 46 years old and single.

Blue Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, eggs, spices, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.  

Blue Mary has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and farming sugarcane.

Blue Mary aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a petty trader who sells plastic bowls, baskets, buckets and containers in Elmina. She has done this for some years now. She is married with 3 children, and she uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase plastic bowls, baskets and containers to sell. With her profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, baskets and containers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase machines and equipment for his work.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que esta bien en sus ventas y por eso necesita invertir para aumentar su potencia en la tienda, se comprara embutidos, cereales, leche, huevos, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, entre otros que sean de la preferencia de los clientes.
El efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior al negocio, fue aumentar su disponibilidad en el inventario, para movilizar más las ventas, considera que su forma ha cambiado, gracias a la inversión que realizo, el techo de su vivienda le realizo reparaciones, para evitar goteras en tiempo de lluvia.
texts.en:
José has decided to ask for a new loan, since he thinks that he is doing quite well in his business, and for this reason, he wants to invest and increase the attractiveness of his grocery store.  He will buy snacks, grains, milk, eggs, rice, sugar, beans, and other goods that his customers prefer.

The effect that his previous loan had upon his business was to expand the readiness of his store's inventory to make his business have more turnover.  He believes that his method of doing business has changed thanks to the investment he was able to make, and he was able to make repairs to the roof of his house to avoid having leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy snacks, grains, milk, eggs, rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, bathing suits, underwear, and pants.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 30, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jerome, who is employed, the father of their children. She and her husband share responsibility for attending to their young children and at the same time earning an income for their daily needs. 

Liezel is a balut vendor. In the Philippines balut is well-known egg that is sold in the sidewalk. It is a duck egg that has not been hatched. Instead, it is cooked as a boiled egg with a delicious small amount of soup inside. It is a highly nutritious food that Filipinos love, especially when they feel tired, as it revitalizes their energy and strength. Se and her husband boil and sell about 450-600 balut eggs every night. They do the selling themselves to avoid the commissions of vendors who would sell it. They earn 300 PHP in sales per day.  

Liezel is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP that she will use to  buy balut and quail eggs. She also has a variety store, and she will use part of the loan to buy groceries and toiletries. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liezel dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life. She never fails to attend weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to go on with her life, no matter what are the obstacles, because she has a big God Who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more balut eggs, quail eggs, and items for her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bags of rice, maize, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti, 26, is the mother of two young children. She lives with her husband and children in the rural area of Samburu where charcoal selling is the most popular activity.
Six months ago she decided to start selling charcoal from her home. She sells to the neighborhood.

Aiming at widening her stock of merchandise, Mwanasiti has requested a 20,000 KES loan. She believes that with financial help she’ll attain business growth that will lead to an improvement in the quality of her family life

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a single mother with one child.  She sells rice, canned fish, canned tomatoes and other things in Elmina, Ghana.  She has done this for some years now.  She uses her income for the upkeep of her child. Comfort will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, boxes of canned fish, tomatoes and other things for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, boxes of canned fish, tomatoes and other things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with five children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old now, married to Stanley, and supports a family of five members. She operates a green grocery and she has been in the business for the last two years. Her monthly income is KES. 10,000.
 
She is currently servicing her second loan from KADET LTD of KES.30,000 that will facilitate purchasing more fruits and vegetable for the now expanded store.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them to sell. She also cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce. Aba has been in this business for some years now. She is married with 3 dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband to feed and clothe their children. Aba  will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry, rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and others to prepare her food for sale. Aba will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry, rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and others to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en: Aleksi, 40, is from the small village of Kareli district. He lives with his wife and 3 infant children. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2.4 hectares of land, on which they grow wheat, nut trees, cherry trees and plum trees. The harvested products are sold locally at a good price. Besides, Aleksi is an artisan and works locally and gets a monthly income. Aleksi requested a loan to help him cultivate his land and buy wheat seeds. After the land is cultivated properly, he will be able to sow wheat and increase the family's income. With this increased income, the living conditions of his family will be improved. Aleksi awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate his land and purchase wheat seeds.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena sells grocery like powdered milk, toffees, powdered pepper, biscuits, and others at Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Philomena has been in this business for some years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to buy groceries like milk, powdered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish and others to satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries like milk, powdered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of five adult children from Antequera, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari, or variety store. She sells various goods to the people in her neighborhood.

Anecita wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she joined CEVI to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization.

Anecita is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries for her store, such canned goods, dry goods, snack food, soda, detergent and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to attract more customers and buyers to her store and thus augment her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store, such canned goods, dry goods, snack food, soda, detergent and toiletries.

loans.name: Lourdes Esperanza

texts.es:
Lourdes, está solicitando un  préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio, por ejemplo leña, diez medidas de maíz, papel, bolsas, entre otras cosas que sean necesarias para que el negocio funcione mejor.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, mejoro su inversión en maíz y leña, a un precio cómodo, con esto logro tener la suficiente cantidad para la venta, en este periodo ha agregado la venta de refrescos, aprovechando los clientes que le visitan.
texts.en:
Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy materials for her business, such as firewood, corn, paper, and bags, among other necessities, so that her business can run better.

Her previous loan had a positive effect. She improved her investment in corn and firewood at an affordable price, so that she had sufficient quantities to sell. During this period, she has added soft drinks sales to her business, accommodating the customers who visit her.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, paper, and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, compost, fertilizers and pesticides, among other things.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina sells cooking utensils and saucepans in Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Faustina has been selling this for 10 years now. She assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils

loans.use: purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Maradi

texts.en:
Maradi is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their 9 children in the rural area of Samburu, which is semi-desert. He is a very hard-working man who has always been characterized as an example in his home. Every morning he wakes up with new dreams and desires to get ahead and be a good father to his family.

At present, Maradi buys and sells goats at the market. He has six years of experience in this line of business.  Thanks to God, he possesses his own clientele, due to his character and the way he attends to the customers who favor his business.

Maradi is quite content because day by day he has been advancing. Determinedly, for some time now Maradi has wanted to expand this, his only source of work, and have a greater number of goats for sale.
He is grateful to everyone who wishes to help him, and he assures all that they will not be defrauded.

loans.use: to buy five goats to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is married with 2 children. She sells African print cloth and fabrics at Elmina, which she has done for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband's efforts to feed, clothe, and pay their children’s school fees.  Monica will use her loan to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Alumenia

texts.en:
Alumenia is 44 years old and married with 2 children, one of whom is in school. Alumenia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Alumenia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future Alumenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 53 years old and married with 5 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elma has a business buying and selling native mats in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of native mats to sell.

Elma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of native mats to sell.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: Maria reside junto a su esposo y su pequeña nieta de 7 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que toda su vida ha luchado y trabajado por darle lo mejor a su familia y hoy que su nieta esta con ella desea brindarle un mejor futuro, por referencia de vecinos destacamos que María es muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable siempre brindando ayuda a quien mas lo necesita junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos los cuales los venden y toman una parte para consumos diario, es así como honradamente se ganan la vida. Lastimosamente Maria siente la necesidad de comprar insumos para cuidar su cosecha es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, una bomba, entre otros .Todo esto a fin que su cosecha mejore. Agradece a Dios ya que espera recibir pronto la ayuda solicitada y así mejorar su condición de vida poco a poco.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and 7 year old granddaughter.  She is a hardworking woman who has fought and worked for most of her life to give her family the best and now wants to provide her granddaughter with a better future.  Maria's neighbors say that she is very hardworking, honest, and responsible, and always provides help to people who need it.  

Together with her husband she works planting basic grains, which they sell and take a part to consume personally.  This is how they earn their living honestly.  Maria needs to purchase supplies to care for her crops, so she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, spray, and other items.  All of these items will improve her harvest.  She thanks God that she will quickly receive the request help so that she can improve her quality of life little by little.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, spray, and other items.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio con su previo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  compró botones, correderas, encajes e insumos en general, con los que fabricó lindos productos que vendió y por eso ganó un poco más.  Ella envía muchos agradecimientos a esta organización y dice “Fue un crédito oportuno y de gran utilidad, por eso pude organizar mi negocio mejor, muchísimas gracias por esta oportunidad. “  Su negocio consiste en un taller de confecciones donde fabrica artículos para damas e infantil especialmente, los cuales vende en su propio punto comercial y a clientes que acceden a su producto el cual ella elabora bajo medidas individuales y ofrece a crédito y de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un   credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará telas al por mayor,una máquina filetadora y botones, que le permitirán, mejorar los tiempos productivos y la calidad, además de cumplir nuevamente con pedidos especiales,  para que las familias celebren elegantemente vestidas, las fiestas navideñas y el año nuevo que ya se acerca. Su éxito radica en su respuesta oportuna a los pedidos, la calidad con la que trabaja y el excelente punto de ubicación comercial en el que se encuentra y las ganas de salir adelante que nunca le faltan.
texts.en:
Rocío used her previous loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy buttons, zippers, lace, and other supplies. With these she made nice products which she sold and earned a little more. She is very grateful to the organization and says, “The loan came at the right time and was really useful. With it I was able to organize my business better. Thank you so much for this opportunity.” 

Rocío has a dressmaking workshop where she makes clothes, mostly for women and children. She sells the clothes at her own stall to customers who pass by there, and she also makes clothes to measure. She receives cash and also lets her customers pay in installments. 

She is currently requesting a loan from Kiva, which will be her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy fabric at wholesale, a serging machine, and buttons. These items will help her to reduce her production time, improve the quality of her goods, and be able to take special orders so that families can celebrate the upcoming holiday season dressed elegantly. Her success is down to her quick turnaround of orders, the quality of her work, her excellent sales location, and her constant hard work and enthusiasm.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric, a serging machine, and buttons to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Andro

texts.en:
Andro is 62 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo, with his wife, Tina. 
The family earns their income from a newly-started business in their local town. Andro has a bakery, where traditional Georgian breads are baked and sold locally. The income from this bakery is hardly enough to cover food and everyday expenses for the family. Andro has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for developing the business, but he hasn't had any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his lack of experience, which is usually demanded by the local credit providers.
Because his income is not enough for the family, Andro has decided to expand the existing business with the requested loan. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Andro will expand his Georgian bakery and increase the amount of baked bread. This will increase sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of Andro's family.

loans.use: to expand his Georgian bakery and bake more bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josephine is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. She is thankful for the previous loan, which helped her increase her inventory. The previous loan has helped her achieve some of her goals, such as being able to send her children to school. Her dream is to see them become professionals. She is currently asking for a new loan to increase her stock. She says that some of the basic commodities are out of stock and she wants to have them to continue serving her customers. She will buy basic grains, detergents, basic medicines, bales of flour, and instant goods.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, basic medicines, bales of flour, and instant goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a petty trader. She sells cooking oil like palm oil and palm kernel oil in Elmina. She has been in this business for years now. Elizabeth is a widow with 2 children who are in school. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels so she can extract the oil to sell. With the new profit, she wants to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kernel so she can extract the oil to sell.

loans.name: Matuyia

texts.en:
Matuyia is 48 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. He has been a practicing wheat farmer for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 19,000. 

He is requesting his first loan, for KES 30,000, from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs which will help him get a good harvest.

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify his business into sheep keeping. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 44-year-old married man and a father of four school-age children from Antequera, Bohol. He earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He transports passengers from one place to another, especially to areas that are not accessible to four-wheel vehicles.

Antonio is asking for a loan to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the motorcycle. Antonio has hopes of making his business grow in the future and exploring other ventures to augment his income so that he can continue supporting the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is 30 years old. She lives with her life companion and with her children. She wants to start a paraffin selling business. Mesalimu is a teacher by profession. She is an active, hardworking woman who is a fighter. 

She would like to make all of her dreams come true because for her, life is a constant struggle on the road where doors to success will open. She is optimistic that she will have a good income from this investment. Mesalimu will buy gallons of paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 59-year-old window who supports a family of six. She is a mixed farmer, and she has been in the business for the last 10 years. Her monthly income is 23,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

She is currently servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD., which she will use to prepare the land and also get seedlings. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, prepare the land and get seedlings.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi, 28, describes herself as a responsible, very hardworking person for her family’s well-being. She lives with her husband and son in the town of Tiribe located in Coast Province.

Mwanaharusi works alone buying and selling dried fish, a business that allows her to cover household expenses. She is currently asking Yehu for a loan to invest in buying more sacks of dried fish to sell.

Mwanaharusi dreams of having a large locale to be able to offer ready goods once her customers need the commodity.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 15 years. She describes herself to be a determined, focused and ambitious woman. She operates a farm where she sells farm produce such as maize, beans, etc. Her business is located in a fertile agricultural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for home consumption. She will use the Kes 11,100 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to diversify her business into other markets so as to sell her farm produce within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will practice horticultural farming which will increase her business income.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
Ana, quiere un nuevo prestamo con la intención de mejorar el inventario para la temporada, comprándose una variedad de calzado para hombres en varios estilos y números, espera que esto le permita en esta temporada mejorar sus ventas.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo financiado anteriormente, le dio un efecto positivo al negocio, mejorando la capacidad para atender la demanda, con esto sus ingresos familiares se han visto en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Ana wants to get a new loan with the intention of improving her inventory for this season, by buying a variety of sizes of footwear for men in different sizes and styles.  She hopes that this will improve her sales during this season.

She says that the loan she accepted before had a positive effect on her business, improving her capacity to respond to demand, and with this help, her family's profits have seen growth.

loans.use: to buy sneakers of various sizes and styles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Kumomoru

texts.en:
Kumomoru is 34 years old, married, and supporting a family of five people. He has been a wheat farmer for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He is requesting his second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify his business into sheep-keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 24 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 3 and 2 years old. He earns his living through buying and selling livestock; he has been in operation for a period of six years, earning an income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) monthly.

He is servicing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. and wishes to purchase more livestock for trading. The profits earned will be used to provide basic needs for the family.  

His dream in life is to prosper in his livestock-trading business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for trading.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single young man. For the past two years, Ahmad has had a mobile phone store. He has a good reputation between customers, so he has many loyal clients who request and buy modern mobiles. This makes Ahmad's project a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but also it needs more support from time to time to cover the cost of bringing in a modern collection of mobiles.

Ahmad is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a collection of mobile phones. This will attract more customers and increase Ahmad's income and insure him a better future.

Ahmad is photographed inside his store.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of mobile phones.

loans.name: Walter Orlando

texts.es: Walter de 35 años de edad vive junto a su familia es un hombre muy trabajador y se caracteriza por ser muy responsable en lo que a el le compete. Su mayor ilusión es brindarle un buen futuro a sus pequeños y espera que cuando ellos crezcan le agradezca su amor y sacrificio. actualmente se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a su vez tiene en su poder ganado es así como el se gana la vida honradamente y en su hogar no falta el pan de cada día. Walter desea comprar insumos básicos como : semillas, abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y también mas ganado como vacas, terneros u otros. Espera y confía en Dios que su ayuda sera escuchada y espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.
texts.en:
Walter, 35, lives with his family.  He's a very hardworking man known for being very responsible for what is incumbent upon him.  His greatest wish is to give his little ones a good future, and he hopes that when they're grown they'll thank him for his love and sacrifice.

Currently he makes a living growing basic grains, and he also has livestock.  This is how he earns a living honestly, and in his home there is never a lack of food.

Walter wants to buy basic supplies such as seeds, manure, pesticide, and fertilizer, as well as more cows, calves, and other livestock.

He hopes and trusts in God that his help will be heard and that he can repay the loan before the deadline.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies and more livestock

loans.name: Silvia Yanira

texts.es: Silvia de 30 años de edad vive junto a su esposo de 31 años y una pequeña de 2 añitos. es un mujer muy comprometedora con su trabajo y sus responsabilidades, honesta, amable y servicial según sus vecinos. Junto a su esposo se dedican a cultivos de granos básicos como frijol, arroz, maíz u otros, siendo esta su fuente de trabajo ya que los sabe vender a buen precio y a su vez deja una parte para consumos propio. Silvia tiene la necesidad de incrementar mas su venta es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar: semillas, abonos , fertilizantes, pesticidas u otros teniendo en cuenta  se aproxima una buena temporada y desea tener el dinero suficiente para realizar tal acción. agradece a Dios que nunca la ha dejado sola y espera recibir la ayuda lo mas pronto posible.
texts.en:
Silvia, 30, lives with her husband, 31, and her little girl just two years old.  She's a woman who's committed to her job and her responsibilities.  According to her neighbors, she's honest, kind, and helpful.

She and her husband make a living growing basic grains such as beans, rice, corn, and other.  This is her source of work because she knows to sell the crops at a good price, and she also sets aside part for her own consumption.

Silvia needs to increase her sales, so she's asking Integral for a loan to be able to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and other supplies.  She's keeping in mind that the good season is approaching and she wants to have enough money to do this.

She's grateful to God, who has never left her alone, and she hopes to receive the help as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and other supplies

loans.name: Fe De Los Porteños Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama ”Fe de los Porteños”  está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; crianza de pollos, feriantes, venta de chocolates, tejidos, venta de herramientas, venta de juguetes, venta de perfumes, venta de tazones, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Denisse, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón de color gris y una chaqueta de color negro, su cabello es de color castaño claro, lo usa suelto y largo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de herramientas, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja en la feria libre los días martes, sábado y domingo ofreciendo todo tipo de herramientas para la atención de su clientela y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra generalmente  en la ciudad de Santiago por la gran variedad y calidad y además  a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará herramientas como martillos, serruchos, alicates, llave inglesa, cepillos, destornillador, tornillos.
Una de las metas de Denisse es poder instalar una ferretería, para ofrecer  gran variedad de herramientas y vender otros tipos de articulos de ferretería.
Denisse vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia y así brindarle un buen pasar a su familia y mejor calidad de vida, y a nivel laboral tener su ferretería para generar mayores ingresos y poder comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Fe de los Porteños."  It is made up of 20 enterprising people who work in different businesses, such as: raising chickens, selling in markets, selling chocolates, weaving, selling tools, selling toys, selling perfumes, selling mugs, providing services, and other businesses.  All of the members of this group live in the city of Viña del Mar.

Denisse is a member of this communal bank.  In the photo, she is seated in the first row, in the first spot on the right, wearing grey pants and a black jacket.  She has light brown hair, which is long and is worn loose.  She has had a business selling tools for a year.  She comments that she works in the free market on Tuesdays, Saturdays and Sundays, offering all types of tools and hardware for sale and waiting on her customers.  She arranges her schedule according to her availability.  She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, where she can get a great variety of good quality items at a low cost.  With this loan, she will buy hardware such as hammers, saws, pliers, wrenches, brushes, screwdrivers, and screws.  One of Denisse's goals is to set up a hardware store, so that she could offer a greater variety of tools and hardware items for sale.  

Denisse lives with her husband and 2 year-old child.  For her family, she dreams of having her own home so that she could provide for her family's well-being and give them a better quality of life. With regard to her work, she dreams of having her own hardware store so that she could generate  more income and be able to buy more merchandise to stock up her business.  

Denisse is very content and grateful for the opportunity being provided by Fondo Esperanza, because it has opened up work opportunities for her, and allowed her to invest in her business.  She's also developed as a person, because she has learned to organize and to allocate her income and investments in a better way.  

Viña del Mar is a city  and commune located on the central Chilean coast.  It is known as the City of Gardens, because of the gardens and patios that are seen among the old homes in the city.  It is also considered to be the tourism capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy tools and hardware such as hammers, saws, pliers, wrenches, brushes, screwdrivers, and screws.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from the small town of Zestaponi. She is 44 years old, divorced and lives with her 24-year-old son. Nino gets her income from a newly started business in her local town. She is involved in a trading business. Nino buys clothes and household items from wholesalers and sells them among her neighbors. The income from this business is hardly enough to cover just food and everyday expenses for the family. 

Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for developing a family business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the lack of experience in her job, which is usually demanded by the local credit providers.

Because the income is not enough for the family, Nino decided to expand the existing business with the requested loan. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Nino will purchase stock of clothes in Tbilisi (the capital city) for wholesale prices and resell them in her town for a profit. It will be hard work for Nino, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for trade.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old. He is married and has six children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, coffee, potatoes, and bananas. They keep cows and chickens. They also run a small commodities shop.

Samuel looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Samuel will invest in his farming business. He dreams of improving his family's daily income and upgrading their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
Remegio is 37 years old. He is married and has five children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, coffee, cassava and sweet potatoes. They keep cows, goats and pigs. They also have a small shop where they sell commodities.

Remegio looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Remegio will grow his farming business. He dreams of constructing a nice house for his family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is a basket weaver from Antequera, Bohol. She has been weaving baskets for more than 20 years now. This is where she gets her income.

Marcosa is asking for a loan to buy more materials for basket weaving such as "buri" native palm, wicker and straw. With this, she will be able to weave more baskets to sell, thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more materials for basket weaving such as buri, wicker and straw.

loans.name: Laine Luz

texts.es: Laine Lozano de 47 años de edad,  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su familia y se dedica a  venta de comidas, actividad que nació al mudarse a la comunidad donde habita, pues es una pequeña ciudad donde su mercado es natural y allí encontró inmensas posibilidades de ofrecer desayunos almuerzos y comidas a sus habitantes. Sus ventas las realiza diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, a sus principales clientes que son los maestros de obras y equipos de trabajo en tareas constructivas de la nueva comunidad que proyecta tener a mas de quince mil habitantes.  Laine ha recibido un financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para la compra de vivienda en este macroproyecto de comunidades sostenibles y hoy está aplicando a un primer credikiva, con el cual comprará víveres, abarrotes, para elaborar comidas  especiales y tendrá mucho éxito, porque reduce sus costos al poder comprar de contado y en mayor volumen,; con su credikiva  aprovecharía también las festividades de fin de año,  para invertir bien y ofrecer a su clientela comidas elaboradas, para compartir muy felices con sus familias y recibir el año nuevo unidos.
texts.en:
Laine Lozano, 47, lives in the city of Cartagena with her family and makes a living selling food.  She started this job when she moved to the community where she lives, because it's a small city with a natural market where she found immense possibilities for offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner to the residents.

She makes her sales from 8 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon.  Her main customers are the construction workers and teams working on the construction of the new community, which is projected to have more than 15,000 inhabitants.

Laine has received one loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a house in this macroproject of sustainable communities.  Now she's applying for her first Kiva loan, with which she'll buy supplies and groceries to make her special meals.

And she'll be very successful because she reduces her costs by being able to buy in cash and wholesale.  With her Kiva loan she'll also take advantage of the end-of-year holidays to invest well and be able to offer prepared foods for her customers to share happily with their families and welcome the new year together.

loans.use: to buy supplies and groceries to make meals

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra de 34 años, aprendió a trabajar con alimentos de su tía, porque siempre le ha gustado las labores de cocina; así fue que cuando decidió generar ingresos a través de un negocio de venta de comidas, su cónyuge fue el primero en apoyarla  con el capital inicial y así ella ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio y   generar ingresos, con los cuales apoya su hogar conformado por su esposo de oficio albañil y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 10 años. En su negocio vende cárnicos fritos, como cerdo, chorizo, cuajo, vísceras etc. en un local ubicado en su domicilio,  el cual atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, es así como los  clientes desayunan, almuerzan y cenan en el negocio de Alejandra. La ubicación de este negocio, potencializa sus ventas, pues está ubicado cerca a un campo de futbol, donde concurren muchos deportistas especialmente los fines de semana y festivos;  su principal meta es ampliarlo, pero su desafío, es no tener el suficiente capital e trabajo para lograrlo tan pronto como Alejandra sueña. Por esta razón ella, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  porque quiere aprovechar que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año, para invertir en materias primas y aumentar el volumen de sus ventas, porque es en esta época  en la cual logra un mayor movimiento de compradores superior a los que usualmente  llegan a su negocio. Y esto es justamente la razón de que su credikiva sea exitoso.
texts.en: Alejandra, 34, learned to work with food from her aunt because she has always enjoyed kitchen work. When she decided to earn income through a business selling food, her partner was the first one to support her with the initial capital. In this way she has succeeded in growing her business and in earning income, with which she supports her household consisting of her husband, a bricklayer, and their two children, aged 3 and 10 years. In her business, she sells fried meat products such as pig, chorizo, rennet, entrails, etc. at a shop located in her house. She waits on customers from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. This is how customers eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner at Alejandra's business. The location of this business improves its sales, since it is located near a soccer field where many sportspeople meet, especially on weekends and holidays. Alejandra's main goal is to expand, but her challenge is not having sufficient capital and work to achieve that as soon as she dreams of doing. Because of this, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She wants to take advantage of the fact that the end of year holidays are approaching to invest in raw materials and increase her sales volume, because it is at this time of year that she has more customers than usually come to her business. And this is precisely the reason that her Kiva loan will be a success.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as beef, pork, and entrails

loans.name: Sophio

texts.en: Sopio is a 30-year-old woman from a small village in the Khashuri district. She lives with her husband and 3 children. Her husband works in the railway company and earns a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 cows, a calf, and 4 pigs. They milk cows and produce cheese. Sopio owns a hectare of land, where she grows haricots (beans) and wheat. She sells the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. She is a very hard-working woman who does her best to ensure a good harvest. Sopio requested a loan to purchase clothing for re-sale. She plans to buy clothing in Turkey and sell it among the villagers as well as in the nearby villages. That will increase the income of her family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Sopio awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for re- sale.

loans.name: Crensesio

texts.en:
Cresencio is a 39-year-old married with 5 children. He is a farmer with a focus in coffee growing. He is growing over 5 acres of coffee and banana plants and has earned a lot from this project. He has managed to send his children to good schools and provide them with the basic necessities of life. 
He wants a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy organic fertilizers and more coffee seedlings to plant in his vast land. He also wants to buy manure for his garden. This will enable him to produce bigger yields and revenue from the sales of his coffee and be in a position to provide for his family. His dream is to be a model farmer of high quality coffee in the region.
His challenge is inadequate coffee seedlings, manures, and fertilizers to put in his coffee and banana gardens.
Cresencio is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 43 years old. He is married and has seven children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow cabbage, eggplant, maize, beans, coffee, cassava, groundnuts, bananas, and vegetables. They have cows, goats, and chickens. They also have a small shop where they sell commodities.

Rogers looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes. He is especially excited about the opportunity to teach farming as a business to others.

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Rogers will invest in his dairy business. His biggest dream is to build a primary school in his village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a 64-year-old married woman and a mother of six adult children from Antequera, Bohol. She earns a living through basket weaving.
She is asking for a loan to buy materials for making baskets like buri, wicker, and straw. With this, she will be able to weave more baskets which will allow her to sell more.

loans.use: to buy materials for making baskets like buri, wicker, and straw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, perticides and manure for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Ya Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ya Kadiatu was born in Kambia town 45 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending secondary school. Ya Kadiatu sells market food – palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. – and has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Ya Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Ya Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy palm-oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria runs a bakeshop in Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the baking business for more than five years now. 

Victoria is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for baking such as flour, milk, sugar, yeast, margarine and butter. In the future, Victoria dreams of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking such as flour, milk, sugar, yeast, margarine and butter.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who is pictured inside his barbershop, is a 21-year-old single young man. He lives with his family and has owned a barbershop for the past year. This is his only source of income. Mohammad's shop is located in the central market of the city where there is good movement of customers. Mohammad has many loyal clients, which makes his business a profitable one, but it needs more support to cover some necessary costs.

Mohammad is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a chair and shaving machine for his barbershop. Taking this loan will improve Mohammad's work in the barbershop, which will satisfy his clients and increase their demand.  This will increase Mohammad's income and insure him a bright future.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a barbershop chair and shaving machine.

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise is 36 years old and is married with four children. She purchases and sells local drinks. She has been in this business for two years, and she works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day. 

Elise has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more local drinks for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more local drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti, 26, says that she is a happy person, hard-working and entrepreneurial. She lives with her husband and three children in the town of Tiribe, located in the coastal region of Kenya.

Mwanasiti makes garments for a living. She also does repairing of torn clothing in her tailoring workshop. She tells us that she has loyal customers and can sell everything that she makes. She has an order for dresses and other garments for the Christmas season that she has to fill and she will use this loan to buy material for making them. The investment will allow her to meet demand from her customers and grow her business. The happier her customers are, she says, the better her income and, in turn, her and her family's quality of life.

Mwanasiti hopes to grow her business around the town so that she can earn enough to provide her children with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima has been involved in small retail business for the past seven years. She is 37 years old and married, and she has three school children.

She sells greens, fruits and vegetables. She currently works alone every day, but her elder child assists her over the weekends. Besides the income she makes from her business, she also receives contributions from her spouse. 

She wants to stock her business with a variety of fruits, greens and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, kale and cabbages, among others. Mwanalima is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits, greens and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, kale and cabbages, among others.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a pedicure/manicure business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF, to buy new tools and a manicure set.

Analie has been in the pedicure/manicure business for three years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tools and a manicure set.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David vive junto a su familia su esposa y sus hijos, es muy caracterizado por ser un buen hombre con buenas referencias por sus vecinos ya que le gusta ayudar y colaborar con quien mas lo necesita, con esfuerzo y dedicación tiene a sus hijos estudiado en la escuela y siente una gran responsabilidad ya que es el único que trabaja por llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, todas las mañana despierta con nuevas ilusiones y deseos de superación y todo para que a sus hijos no les falte nada el día de mañana. David desde hace 5 años se dedica a el cultivo de granos básicos gracias a Dios y a su manera de ser le va bien ya que sabe venderlos a buen precio es así como diariamente se gana la vida honradamente, aunque siente el deseo de incrementar mas su venta es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL para comprar insumos básicos como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas espera que su ayuda sea escuchada y agradece a Dios todopoderoso por lo que pronto recibirá.
texts.en:
David lives with his family, which includes his wife and their children.  He is known for being a good man with good references from his neighbors, because he likes to help and work with those who need it the most.  With a lot of effort and dedication, he has his children in school.  He feels a great responsibility, because his is the only work that brings in support to the household.  He wakes up every morning with new dreams and a desire to excel for his children, so that they will lack for nothing the following day.  For 5 years, David has been growing basic grains.  Thanks to God and his manner of living it is going very well for him, because he knows how to sell his products at a good price.  This is the honorable way in which he makes his daily living.  

David wishes to increase his sales, and so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy basic supplies such as: seed, organic and chemical fertilizers, and pesticides.  He hopes that his request for assistance will be heard, and he thanks the all-powerful God for what he will shortly receive.

loans.use: to buy basic farming supplies such as: seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC Luchando por una misma Causa, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la Primavera, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

María Magdalena se dedica a la Agricultura  al siembra de maíz, fréjol , arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y patos. El dinero lo Utilizará para comprar semillas, insumos, urea. Con la ayuda del  crédito podrá hacer crecer los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad Ventanas.

El sueño es poner un negocio de venta de ropa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas la langosta y el Orosco. En el tiempo libre le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 35 years old. She is single and has four children. She lives with her children and her parents in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the "Luchando por una misma Causa" ("Fighting for the Same Cause") communal bank located in the rural community of La Primavera in Ventanas canton. This communal bank works in short-cycle agriculture growing corn and rice.

María Magdalena is a farmer and grows corn, rice, and beans. She also raises chickens and ducks. She will use the money to buy seeds, supplies, and urea. With the help of the loan, she will be able to grow her crops. She will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

Her dream is to start a clothing store.

The challenges she faces are crop infestations such as "langosta" and "Orosco". In her free time, she likes to dance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, and urea

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es:
José Patricio tiene 38 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC Luchando por una misma Causa, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la Primavera, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Patricio se dedica a la Agricultura  al siembra de maíz, fréjol , arroz. El dinero lo Utilizará para comprar semillas, insumos y arrendar terrenos. Con la ayuda del  crédito podrá arrendar más terreno para sembrar. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad Ventanas. El sueño es comprarce un carro.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas la langosta y el Orosco. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
José Patricio, 38, is single and has no children.  He lives in Ventanas, in the Los Rios province.

He is a member of the communal bank "Luchando Por Una Misma Causa, " which is located in Recinto La Primavera in Ventanas canton.  This communal bank is made up of farmers who work in short cycle agriculture, cultivating corn and rice.

José Patricio is a farmer who cultivates corn, beans and rice.  He will use this money to buy seeds and supplies and to rent land.  With this help of this loan, he will be able to rent more land to cultivate.  He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  His dream is to buy a car.

The challenges that he faces are the locust and Orosco infestations.  In his free time, he enjoys playing ball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies and to rent land

loans.name: Al-Amana Group

texts.en:
